tasks. This change creates a system which is far simpler and more easily
understood, however simplicity comes at the cost of container creation
and image pull performance; the multiprocessing python script was faster
on a per-host basis. Eventhough there is a performance impcat with this change,
it should be noted that this will greatly assist us in further decoupling
the stack from puppet.

Change-Id: Ic9bd0e46ba7dcebfcd61efe6425ac7d6f9fa40f8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Convert the container-puppet to ansible

This change converts the container functions within `container-puppet.py` to
using pure ansible. While the script `container-puppet.py` still remains it
only function now is to create required hashed files.

> In a future PR the `container-puppet.py` script will be fully removed

All of the functionality has been ported from the python script into ansible
tasks. This change creates a system which is far simpler and more easily
understood, however simplicity comes at the cost of container creation
and image pull performance; the multiprocessing python script was faster
on a per-host basis. Eventhough there is a performance impcat with this change,
it should be noted that this will greatly assist us in further decoupling
the stack from puppet.

Change-Id: Ic9bd0e46ba7dcebfcd61efe6425ac7d6f9fa40f8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix _list_view function for count

When doing `manila list --count True` without shares, the user gets
an error. This happens because _list_view do not handle count
properly for 0 shares. This patch-set adds a fix for this case.

Change-Id: Ic6b45260ae39da9ec2c29d05c76d85be1e20635d
Closes-bug: #1822815

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 13:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup useless warnings for podman

Both "cleanup" and "delete" commands are supported when podman is the
container cli. The warnings were probably added when podman didn't
support them but now we have the code in Paunch which can rename
containers, needed by these functions.

Change-Id: I7025cb7fee5362adcba7d8539916a705a0ed2f87
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup useless warnings for podman

Both "cleanup" and "delete" commands are supported when podman is the
container cli. The warnings were probably added when podman didn't
support them but now we have the code in Paunch which can rename
containers, needed by these functions.

Change-Id: I7025cb7fee5362adcba7d8539916a705a0ed2f87

Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

- project

- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

messages:
[{'account_id': 30957, 'date': '2019-09-09 10:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-09 10:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29551, 'date': '2019-09-09 11:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14287, 'date': '2019-09-09 12:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Update README examples on yum update/install

Drop compare_host_packages parameter and description from examples
This was dropped some time ago in
c9d085729f62dfcfeeaecccf36c3c0161414afb7

Also highlight that only file repositories will be used in yum update
task

commit_message:
mistral-executor image install novajoin package

This is required in a nova-less scenario where the provision workflow
needs to include the novajoin cloud-init script in the config_drive
data so that the provisioned node can be registered with FreeIPA.

Change-Id: Ie57ab22b72b172985a3fff02bb4d8915c9df4152
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 23:51:44.000000000', 'message': "We don't have to keep the retrieved token anymore

Since the change in s3_token_middleware to retrieve the auth info
from keystone directly, now, we don't need to have any tokens provided
by keystone in the request header as X-Auth-Token.

Note that this makes the pipeline ordering change documented in the
related changes mandatory, even when working with a v2 Keystone server.

Change-Id: I7c251a758dfc1fedb3fb61e351de305b431afa79
Related-Change: I21e38884a2aefbb94b76c76deccd815f01db7362
Related-Change: Ic9af387b9192f285f0f486e7171eefb23968007e
"}, {'created': '2018-10-10 00:41:44.000000000', 'message': "We don't have to keep the retrieved token anymore

Since the change in s3_token_middleware to retrieve the auth info
from keystone directly, now, we don't need to have any tokens provided
by keystone in the request header as X-Auth-Token.

Note that this makes the pipeline ordering change documented in the
related changes mandatory, even when working with a v2 Keystone server.

Change-Id: I7c251a758dfc1fedb3fb61e351de305b431afa79

commit_message:
We don't have to keep the retrieved token anymore

Since the change in s3_token_middleware to retrieve the auth info
from keystone directly, now, we don't need to have any tokens provided
by keystone in the request header as X-Auth-Token.

Note that this makes the pipeline ordering change documented in the
related changes mandatory, even when working with a v2 Keystone server.

Change-Id: I7c251a758dfc1fedb3fb61e351de305b431afa79
Related-Change: I21e38884a2aefbb94b76c76deccd815f01db7362
Related-Change: Ic9af387b9192f285f0f486e7171eefb23968007e

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL specifc issue with credentials encoding

Decode the encrypted credential value to a string value before handing
it over the database, when running under Python 3.x. Otherwise the
underlying database driver (e.g. psycopg2) might treat it as binary
data.

Change-Id: I87425b54f471e66a9ab3974ab46c4b7f3838b962
Closes-Bug: #1833739

commit_message:
Explicitly make a list

In python2 .keys() returns a list when in python3 it returns
\"{'Compute': dict_keys(['compute-0'])}\""}
This patch adds "list" filter to explicitly convert to list. The change
is python2 and python3 compatible.

Change-Id: I2830211fe635434e14ba03900aad435bede1399d
(cherry picked from commit da75c68ec71f15ae928f6bf4cde1b261861ccb02)

commit_message:
Remove the Pike stable branch jobs from master gate

Patrole 0.6.0 is released now, which marks the end of support
for Pike release - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672485/

We do not need to run the Pike stable job om master gate now.

Change-Id: Id0579ce285f24c24a57c6674f93798215848441d

commit_message:
Update the bandit.yaml available tests list

According to the bandit current version document,
the B109 and B111 plugin has been removed.
And Add the following tests:
Complete Test Plugin Listing: B507, B610, B611, B703
Blacklist Plugins Listing: B322, B323, B325, B413, B414
Reference URL: https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/index.html

Change-Id: I5e9365f9147776d7d90c6ba889acbde3c0e6c19d
Closes-Bug: #1838361

commit_message:
Fix invalid assert states

This is to fix invalid assert states like:
    self.assertTrue('sync_point2: 5', lines.pop().strip())
    self.assertTrue('sync_point1: 5', lines.pop().strip())
    self.assertTrue('bytes: 1100', lines.pop().strip())
    self.assertTrue('deletes: 2', lines.pop().strip())
    self.assertTrue('puts: 3', lines.pop().strip())
    self.assertTrue('1', jobs_to_delete[0]['partition'])
in which assertEqual should be used.

Change-Id: Ide5af2ae68fae0e5d6eb5c233a24388bb9942144

commit_message:
Fix issue with pip2 command and update pip3 for mongodb

This patch will fix following issue logs:

   2019-09-02 15:11:13.121 | dib-run-parts Running /tmp/in_target.d/install.d/25-trove-mongo-dep
   2019-09-02 15:11:13.124 | + pip2 install pymongo
   2019-09-02 15:11:13.125 | /tmp/in_target.d/install.d/25-trove-mongo-dep: line 9: pip2: command not found

And move on pip3.

Change-Id: I7cf16820091a0f977b41e3222abb866a9ae66166

remove those jobs.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I63d12861e1ff5d444d116188a2a122eca5c45af0
(cherry picked from commit 6d540e49e6c483990d3ae87d35992a9d67e670be)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch stable/rocky jobs to OVS 2.11 branch and remove master jobs

While the master branch should change to build from the
new OVN repo, stable branches should build from a stable
version of it.

We don't want to test stable release against master OVS/OVN, so lets
remove those jobs.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I63d12861e1ff5d444d116188a2a122eca5c45af0
(cherry picked from commit 6d540e49e6c483990d3ae87d35992a9d67e670be)

commit_message:
[redhat] Update variables to be version agnostic

The RedHat-based operating systems such as CentOS have a pretty
stable list of packages, therefore, we don't need to pin it by
version and we can instead move to a much more generic redhat.yml
which will support a bigger range of systems.

Change-Id: I5eaa3cb6b3bcae96ff8ebebb368eb4a6fdfd1bae

commit_message:
Only clone console repos on source based installs

For distro package based deployments, install the packaged nova console
proxies and console clients packages instead of git repos.

For debian/ubuntu installs, use the console client packages directly so
that the service configs of console proxy services are managed by OSA.

Change-Id: I27577ea263d38555e73ead078526cff1c3114b5a

[{'created': '2019-08-07 23:17:11.000000000', 'message': 'oscwrap: make a little quieter

A huge part of the logs is irrelevant bash aliases captured by the
openstack client timing wrapper from the run of "openstack complete",
which is only helpful on interactive systems where you'll interact
with the command line.  Call it directly to avoid capturing the logs.

While we're here, turn off tracing inside the oscwrap function, which
is called frequently.  It's not useful for debugging.

'}]
commit_message:
oscwrap: make a little quieter

A huge part of the logs is irrelevant bash aliases captured by the
openstack client timing wrapper from the run of "openstack complete",
which is only helpful on interactive systems where you'll interact
with the command line.  Call it directly to avoid capturing the logs.

While we're here, turn off tracing inside the oscwrap function, which
is called frequently.  It's not useful for debugging.

Change-Id: I1cb5399fe7ee6f0e547a9cfff70396aa2007632e

commit_message:
[train][goal] Run 'tempest-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the new job 'tempest-ipv6-only'(adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6 and run smoke
tests and IPv6 related tests present in Tempest.

This job will be part of Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Keystone, Glance, Swift
gate.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'tempest-ipv6-only' will run the smoke + IPv6 related test case.

This commit adds the new job 'tempest-ipv6-only' run on gate.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35932

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I78be2ee5a7f1e5d3188ece98d7d8324f1c9bd0e3

commit_message:
Register novajoin endpoint by default

The novajoin docs for configure_endpoint say the default is true, but
the implementation is set to false. This change makes them consistent
by making both true.

This has not been an issue because nova is configured in nova.conf for
the location of the novajoin endpoint. However for a nova-less
undercloud it should be possible to discover the novajoin endpoint
from the catalog so that other services (such as mistral during a
workflow) can discover the endpoint.

Change-Id: Ibdd57bf303fc1b1e5e6572c107e8995674f84da2
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Revert "Update for f29"

This reverts commit ba50347526ea76b501dacf774ea6f0997361358c.

Dnf is not enabled by default on RedHat and CentOs based OS.
The is_fedora function of devstack also applies
to RedHat and CentOs based OS, resulting in a failure
when trying to execute dnf.

Zun-compute formats attached block devices.

commit_message:
Add volume-related packages to zun-compute image

This lets Zun containers use Cinder volumes.

Zun-compute formats attached block devices.
ext* and xfs are the most common filesystems and have tools
included in other relevant images.

In case of Ceph ceph-common is required for rbd attachment.

iSCSI is supported via packages installed in base.

Change-Id: Ib094ae8fcc8468949b3cd162a1cedba3fdfd3a47
Related-bug: #1797448
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Validate server_certs_key_passphrase is 32 chars

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

Change-Id: I334364d4654491bc0d289472ca9ab5fe462d5139
(cherry picked from commit a77667339d735ec0757d1e46d80f0010b1bb3d4f)

commit_message:
Validate server_certs_key_passphrase is 32 chars

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 08:51:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add package systemd-sysv to bifrost-deploy image

CMD of image bifrost-deploy is set to "/sbin/init" which is part
of package "systemd-sysv" on debian based distros:

dpkg -S /sbin/init

commit_message:
Add package systemd-sysv to bifrost-deploy image

CMD of image bifrost-deploy is set to "/sbin/init" which is part
of package "systemd-sysv" on common systemd-based distros.

Change-Id: Ie2195248443e37dc22b713ecd1eb6de2876446d3
Closes-Bug: 1840949

commit_message:
Update "openstack_release" variable to static brach name

Since we use the release name as the default tag to publish images
to Dockerhub, we should use this by default.

This change also removes support for the magic value "auto".

Change-Id: I5610cc7729e9311709147ba5532199a033dfd156
Closes-Bug: #1843518

commit_message:
Replace url with endpoint in credentials provider

python-openstackclient has removed the --os-url option in [1]. This
commit is part of the upcoming 4.0.0 release.

The openstack provider relies on that for Keystone initial configuration,
so we need to fix this or puppet-keystone will be broken.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/677795

Change-Id: I50830450efe7a13be801a31f4ef0333684c7837b

commit_message:
tasks: add conditionals for ironic

This patch avoids running the nova_compute.yml playbook
entirely because we already skip the setup portion and we
don't need to setup SSH keys (as there's no live migration)
nor setting up NFS.

It also gets rid of the set_fact inside nova_virt_detect.yml
because it was non-functional in the first place.  This is
because the nova_virt_type was set to 'ironic' in the
group_vars which meant that the autodetect code was
skipped and therefore that portion never ran.

Change-Id: Ic5548f08d200402538a0334f801834ee7ef8a39b
(cherry picked from commit efe094aa674c1444473e55a178dfc98ea80e59ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 15:51:33.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix properties in cinder_type provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"volume_backend_name='BACKEND_1'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'volume_backend_name': u'BACKEND_1'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the cinder_type provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800
'}, {'created': '2019-09-19 12:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix properties in cinder_type provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"volume_backend_name='BACKEND_1'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'volume_backend_name': u'BACKEND_1'}"
or
...,"{'volume_backend_name': 'BACKEND_1'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the cinder_type provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800
'}]
commit_message:
Fix properties in cinder_type provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"volume_backend_name='BACKEND_1'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'volume_backend_name': u'BACKEND_1'}"
or
...,"{'volume_backend_name': 'BACKEND_1'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the cinder_type provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800

Add proper permissions on script

Change Iaabaf571f6ec3c08db16a309a845d3bd4c150e1a added
script to stop and disable libvirtd on controller nodes.
This change adds proper permisions (755) on script to make
it executable.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 08:57:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition when getting cmdline

Even though we check for the existence of the process before, it may
still terminate before we get to read its command line, so catch the
error that can occur here.

Change-Id: I3e89aca8bedfd2912effe2490718223f7d03133e
Closes-Bug: 1844500

commit_message:
Fix race condition when getting cmdline

Even though we check for the existence of the process before, it may
still terminate before we get to read its command line, so catch the
error that can occur here.

Change-Id: I3e89aca8bedfd2912effe2490718223f7d03133e
Closes-Bug: 1844500

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-19 18:17:15.000000000', 'message': "WIP: hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently.

On a somewhat unrelated aside, this whole hardware file really needs to
be rewritten. It's horrible.

TODO: The entire upgrade flow is broken with this as-is. We need to
handle (a) compute nodes that return legacy versions of the NUMACell
object and (b) NUMACell objects with legacy fields set.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-08-01 18:07:35.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently. There are a lot of mechanical changes required
to fix these. The bulk of these fall into one of three categories:

- Defining 'pcpuset' for any 'NUMACell' definitions and, where
  necessary, migrating the 'cpuset' value to this
- Configuring the 'cpu_shared_set' and 'cpu_dedicated_set' config
  options (from the '[compute]' group) instead of overriding
  'nova.virt.hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set'
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the
  'pinned_cpus' field on the same object)

The only serious deviation from this is the
'test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_pinning_realtime' test,
which has to have configuration added to ensure the guest looks like it
has CPU pinning configured. This test was pretty much broken before.

A future change will rename most of the fields on the 'NUMATopology'
object to use more sensible names, but that's a separate change that
shouldn't be done here.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-02 18:01:12.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently. There are a lot of mechanical changes required
to fix these. The bulk of these fall into one of three categories:

- Defining 'pcpuset' for any 'NUMACell' definitions and, where
  necessary, migrating the 'cpuset' value to this
- Configuring the 'cpu_shared_set' and 'cpu_dedicated_set' config
  options (from the '[compute]' group) and changing calls to
  'nova.virt.hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set' to '_get_vcpu_available'
  and/or '_get_pcpu_available'
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the
  'pinned_cpus' field on the same object)

The only serious deviation from this is the
'test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_pinning_realtime' test,
which has to have configuration added to ensure the guest looks like it
has CPU pinning configured. This test was pretty much broken before.

A future change will rename most of the fields on the 'NUMATopology'
object to use more sensible names, but that's a separate change that
shouldn't be done here.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-08-23 16:44:15.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently. There are a lot of mechanical changes required
to fix these. The bulk of these fall into one of three categories:

- Defining 'pcpuset' for any 'NUMACell' definitions and, where
  necessary, migrating the 'cpuset' value to this (hint: if we were
  testing something to do with a instance NUMA topology with pinning,
  we need to migrate the host NUMA topology to 'pcpuset')
- Configuring the 'cpu_shared_set' and 'cpu_dedicated_set' config
  options (from the '[compute]' group) and changing calls to
  'nova.virt.hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set' to '_get_vcpu_available'
  and/or '_get_pcpu_available'
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the
  'pinned_cpus' field on the same object)

The only serious deviation from this is the

"}, {'created': '2019-09-04 17:46:39.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently. There are a lot of mechanical changes required
to fix these. The bulk of these fall into one of three categories:

- Migrating 'NUMACell.cpuset' values to 'NUMACell.pcpuset' where
  necessary (hint: if we were testing something to do with a instance
  NUMA topology with pinning, we need to migrate the field)
- Configuring the 'cpu_shared_set' and 'cpu_dedicated_set' config
  options (from the '[compute]' group) and changing calls to
  'nova.virt.hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set' to '_get_vcpu_available'
  and/or '_get_pcpu_available'. This is necessary because the
  '_get_guest_numa_config' function has changed to call the latter
  instead of the former.
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the
  'pinned_cpus' field on the same object)

The only serious deviation from this is the
'test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_pinning_realtime' test,
which has to have configuration added to ensure the guest looks like it
has CPU pinning configured. This test was pretty much broken before.

It's useful to understand the lifecycle of the 'NUMATopology' object in
order to understand the upgrade impacts of this change, in so far as it
relates to the libvirt virt driver. We generate a 'NUMATopology' object
on the compute node in the 'LibvirtDriver._get_host_numa_topology'
method and report that as part of the 'ComputeNode' object provided to
the resource tracker from the 'LibvirtDriver.get_available_resource'
method. The 'NUMATopology' object generated by the driver *does not*
include any usage information, meaning the fields 'cpu_usage',
'pinned_cpus' and 'memory_usage' are set to empty values. Instead, these
are calculated by calling the 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function. This happens in two places, in the resource tracker as part of
the 'ResourceTracker._update_usage' method, which is called by the
'ResourceTracker.update_usage' periodic task as well as by other
internal operations each time a instance is created, moved or destroyed,
and in the 'HostState._update_from_compute_node' method, which is called
by the 'HostState.update' method on the scheduler at startup.

As a result of the above, there isn't a significant upgrade impact for
this and it remains possible to run older Stein-based compute nodes
alongside newer Train-based compute nodes. There are two things that
make this possible. Firstly, at no point in this entire process does a
'NUMATopology' object make its way back to the compute node once it
leaves, by way of a 'ComputeNode' object. That's true for objects in
general and means we don't need to worry about the compute node seeing
these new object fields and not being able to understand them. Secondly,
we have checks in that crucial 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function, which will check if 'pcpuset' is not set (meaning it's a
pre-Train compute node) and set this locally. Because the virt driver
doesn't set the usage-related fields, this is the only field we need to
care about.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

the resource tracker from the 'LibvirtDriver.get_available_resource'
method. The 'NUMATopology' object generated by the driver *does not*
include any usage information, meaning the fields 'cpu_usage',
'pinned_cpus' and 'memory_usage' are set to empty values. Instead, these
are calculated by calling the 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function. This happens in two places, in the resource tracker as part of
the 'ResourceTracker._update_usage' method, which is called by the
'ResourceTracker.update_usage' periodic task as well as by other
internal operations each time a instance is created, moved or destroyed,
and in the 'HostState._update_from_compute_node' method, which is called
by the 'HostState.update' method on the scheduler at startup.

As a result of the above, there isn't a significant upgrade impact for
this and it remains possible to run older Stein-based compute nodes
alongside newer Train-based compute nodes. There are two things that
make this possible. Firstly, at no point in this entire process does a
'NUMATopology' object make its way back to the compute node once it
leaves, by way of a 'ComputeNode' object. That's true for objects in
general and means we don't need to worry about the compute node seeing
these new object fields and not being able to understand them. Secondly,
we have checks in that crucial 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function, which will check if 'pcpuset' is not set (meaning it's a
pre-Train compute node) and set this locally. Because the virt driver
doesn't set the usage-related fields, this is the only field we need to
care about.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

  and/or '_get_pcpu_available'. This is necessary because the

  instead of the former.
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the

commit_message:
hardware: Differentiate between shared and dedicated CPUs

Start making use of the new fields added to the 'NUMACell' object and
store things differently. There are a lot of mechanical changes required
to fix these. The bulk of these fall into one of three categories:

- Migrating 'NUMACell.cpuset' values to 'NUMACell.pcpuset' where
  necessary (hint: if we were testing something to do with a instance
  NUMA topology with pinning, we need to migrate the field)
- Configuring the 'cpu_shared_set' and 'cpu_dedicated_set' config
  options (from the '[compute]' group) and changing calls to
  'nova.virt.hardware.get_vcpu_pin_set' to '_get_vcpu_available'
  and/or '_get_pcpu_available'. This is necessary because the
  '_get_guest_numa_config' function has changed to call the latter
  instead of the former.
- Removing checks for 'NUMACell.cpu_usage' for pinned tests, since this
  no longer counts usage of pinned CPUs (that's handled by the
  'pinned_cpus' field on the same object)

The only serious deviation from this is the
'test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_pinning_realtime' test,
which has to have configuration added to ensure the guest looks like it
has CPU pinning configured. This test was pretty much broken before.

It's useful to understand the lifecycle of the 'NUMATopology' object in
order to understand the upgrade impacts of this change, in so far as it
relates to the libvirt virt driver. We generate a 'NUMATopology' object
on the compute node in the 'LibvirtDriver._get_host_numa_topology'
method and report that as part of the 'ComputeNode' object provided to
the resource tracker from the 'LibvirtDriver.get_available_resource'
method. The 'NUMATopology' object generated by the driver *does not*
include any usage information, meaning the fields 'cpu_usage',
'pinned_cpus' and 'memory_usage' are set to empty values. Instead, these
are calculated by calling the 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function. This happens in two places, in the resource tracker as part of
the 'ResourceTracker._update_usage' method, which is called by the
'ResourceTracker.update_usage' periodic task as well as by other
internal operations each time a instance is created, moved or destroyed,
and in the 'HostState._update_from_compute_node' method, which is called
by the 'HostState.update' method on the scheduler at startup.

As a result of the above, there isn't a significant upgrade impact for
this and it remains possible to run older Stein-based compute nodes
alongside newer Train-based compute nodes. There are two things that
make this possible. Firstly, at no point in this entire process does a
'NUMATopology' object make its way back to the compute node once it
leaves, by way of a 'ComputeNode' object. That's true for objects in
general and means we don't need to worry about the compute node seeing
these new object fields and not being able to understand them. Secondly,
we have checks in that crucial 'hardware.numa_usage_from_instance_numa'
function, which will check if 'pcpuset' is not set (meaning it's a
pre-Train compute node) and set this locally. Because the virt driver
doesn't set the usage-related fields, this is the only field we need to
care about.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Validate CPU config options against running instances

We want to make sure people who have both pinned and unpinned instances
on a host (yes, it's dumb, but it happens) won't do a straightforward
'vcpu_pin_set' -> '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' or '[compute]
cpu_shared_set' transition, breaking their ability to restart or rebuild
instances. We add a new 'supports_pcpus' driver capability to avoid
needing to do this on drivers that don't support PCPUs and CPU pinning
in general.

Change-Id: Ia1b3ab0b66fdaf569f6c7a09510f208ee28725b2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 17:46:39.000000000', 'message': "objects: Add 'NUMACell.pcpuset' field

We will use this to track host CPUs intended for dedicated workloads in
a future change. For now, we simply add the field and set it in all
instances of 'NUMACell'. This change has the benefit of allowing us to
avoid overloading the meaning of some fields, as described below. This
doesn't happen here but rather with change
I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db.

Before:

  pinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by pinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in total
      integer format
    NUMACell.pinned_cpus
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in mapping
      format

  unpinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by unpinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by unpinned instances in total
      integer format

After:

  pinned instances ->

    NUMACell.pcpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by pinned instances
    NUMACell.pinned_cpus
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in mapping
      format

  unpinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by unpinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by unpinned instances in total
      integer format

In summary, we go from overloading the 'cpuset' and 'cpu_usage' fields
to having dedicated fields for pinned and unpinned CPUs. As an aside, it
would be nice if the field names were a little more uniform, but that
can be addressed in the future.

Change-Id: I7407a8e662d7b4a710d5a133ef22d2b25e26ad89
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

      Tracks the usage of host cores by unpinned instances in total
      integer format

In summary, we go from overloading the 'cpuset' and 'cpu_usage' fields
to having dedicated fields for pinned and unpinned CPUs. As an aside, it
would be nice if the field names were a little more uniform, but that
can be addressed in the future.

Change-Id: I7407a8e662d7b4a710d5a133ef22d2b25e26ad89
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
objects: Add 'NUMACell.pcpuset' field

We will use this to track host CPUs intended for dedicated workloads in
a future change. For now, we simply add the field and set it in all
instances of 'NUMACell'. This change has the benefit of allowing us to
avoid overloading the meaning of some fields, as described below. This
doesn't happen here but rather with change
I492803eaacc34c69af073689f9159449557919db.

Before:

  pinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by pinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in total
      integer format
    NUMACell.pinned_cpus
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in mapping
      format

  unpinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by unpinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by unpinned instances in total
      integer format

After:

  pinned instances ->

    NUMACell.pcpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by pinned instances
    NUMACell.pinned_cpus
      Tracks the usage of host cores by pinned instances in mapping
      format

  unpinned instances ->

    NUMACell.cpuset
      Tracks the host cores that can be used by unpinned instances
    NUMACell.cpu_usage
      Tracks the usage of host cores by unpinned instances in total
      integer format

In summary, we go from overloading the 'cpuset' and 'cpu_usage' fields
to having dedicated fields for pinned and unpinned CPUs. As an aside, it
would be nice if the field names were a little more uniform, but that
can be addressed in the future.

Change-Id: I7407a8e662d7b4a710d5a133ef22d2b25e26ad89
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create mgmt subnet with gateway if provided

This change adds the ability to create the mgmt subnet with default
gateway when the specified variable provided.

Change-Id: Ief7f60972c62388cee1f579e8988c4ba57c8fb65
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate overcloud image prepare

We have replaced this function with the `openstack tripleo container
image prepare` command which is more flexible.

Change-Id: Ib4403d5040d2965575a87adbc2e2ca59aa286467

subject: Fix prometheus-alertmanager cluster bug
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-18 12:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-18 12:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-09-19 17:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 12:50:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix prometheus-alertmanager cluster bug

Edited the
ansible/roles/prometheus/templates/prometheus-alertmanager.json.j2 file
to change the mesh.peer and mesh.listen-address to cluter.peer and
cluster.listen-address.  This stopped alertmanager from crashing with
error "--mesh.peer is an invalid flag"

Change-Id: Ia0447674b9ec377a814f37b70b4863a2bd1348ce
Signed-off-by: Mark Flynn <markandrewflynn@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 01eb7a63a5121a2580615c2c7fa85490ee916c7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prometheus-alertmanager cluster bug

Edited the
ansible/roles/prometheus/templates/prometheus-alertmanager.json.j2 file
to change the mesh.peer and mesh.listen-address to cluter.peer and
cluster.listen-address.  This stopped alertmanager from crashing with
error "--mesh.peer is an invalid flag"

Change-Id: Ia0447674b9ec377a814f37b70b4863a2bd1348ce
Signed-off-by: Mark Flynn <markandrewflynn@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 01eb7a63a5121a2580615c2c7fa85490ee916c7a)

I'm not sure it won't work if you specify localhost or 127.0.0.1, I think I deployed and it was OK. Maybe better just to add a warning, but not to break the installation."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-08-26 09:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I'm not sure it won't work if you specify localhost or 127.0.0.1, I
 > think I deployed and it was OK. Maybe better just to add a warning,
 > but not to break the installation.

The documentation explicitly says to not use 127.0.0.1 because it's reserved, if that changes, maybe we should update the documentation.."}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-08-26 13:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-08-26 13:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Sagi, thanks for the review.  As @Arx pointed out, the documentation explicitly says not to use localhost or 127.0.0.1.  The installation fails in unexpected ways when you do.

I added this patch because I lost hours trying to figure out why the installation failed.  I think it is better to fail fast when we know the inputs are wrong and that the installation will fail regardless.'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-09-04 14:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-09-13 06:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-09-15 07:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-09-16 11:33:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-09-16 12:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-09-17 07:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-09-17 07:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(I'll +A in a bit unless someone else beats me to it or there is any other update)"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-09-17 08:30:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-17 20:13:08.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We are facing gate issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1844446

To clear the gate we need to abandon this patch and I will restore once the gate is ready again to land patches in TripleO. Please don't touch this patch, and ask on #tripleo Wes or Emilien for any question. Thanks for your patience."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-19 02:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

commit_message:
Fail when $VIRTHOST is localhost

There are known issues when using tripleo-quickstart
with localhost or 127.0.0.1 as the target host. See [1].

This patch adds a check to make sure that neither one of
those addresses are being used as $VIRTHOST and fails with
a message to use 127.0.0.2 instead.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/2.1.0/readme.html#deploying-on-localhost

Change-Id: I5de0fc46c6b89592b42e230b73bc9a4048530b69

Remove old releasenote script

This script is no longer used as you can tox -e releasenotes now which
uses sphinx directly.

Change-Id: Ifa0ca97abaff191cabef3bc55dd9c05a9291c5ad

commit_message:
Add IPv6 condition to set to the local_address

This change re-adds the local_address IPv6 condition to the kernel
template. This will ensure that the local address is always set using
our expected conditions.

Depends-On: I20e69315bacdded4bc2d5b47e18609f130f8abc5
Change-Id: I01d0f20f6f78d235f99f51f75bcefe675dc0dee5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Don't use docker override in scenario012 standalone ironic

It's set in job definition:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/blob/master/zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml#L585

Change-Id: Ia5285e530417c50bded380593877b5614c5784ef

commit_message:
Add _find_ovn_lb_by_id() in OvnProviderHelper

There were four code paths doing the same thing, created
a helper to lookup a loadbalancer given a pool id.

Change-Id: I6d4a4b396eaa0d4be2a2c7afeccdb336020a40b3

commit_message:
Correct availability_zone to be non-mandatory in heat

As per CLI and GUI, availability_zone is not mandatory.  In templates,
it is.  This is incorrect.

This patch corrects behaviour to match CLI and GUI.

Change-Id: Ice37340f084ea65bd4b46562145e82ede6bc0df5
Closes-Bug: 1749767

commit_message:
Use memcached for token caching in octavia authtoken

Use memcached to cache token in octavia authtoken, as in-process
cache, which we currently use, was already deprecated[1].

[1] Ied2b88c8cefe5655a88d0c2f334de04e588fa75a

Change-Id: I09a73ae54e7b4b04396c3b31063833eca8bf5352

commit_message:
Fix base (VRRP) port abandoned on revert

If the base (VRRP) port fails to attach to the amphora instance, the
port would not be deleted as part of the revert cleanup.
This patch splits the two plug VIP phases and attempts to clean up the
base (VRRP) port, that was created in the first phase, should the port
attach fail.

Change-Id: Ieab13c1152fed64da7390891b315b5e67513ce3e
Story: 2006468
Task: 36399
(cherry picked from commit f20dc158441faad8422f7836dc7d0af50dcbcb0a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 11:53:37.000000000', 'message': 'Trigger real BuildAbortException during migrate with bandwidth

The functional test
test_migrate_server_with_qos_port_pci_update_fail_not_reschedule used
fault injection to simulate that the
_update_pci_request_spec_with_allocated_interface_name call raises
BuildAbortException during migrating a instance with an SRIOV port
having resource request.

We can do a bit better. This patch simulates that neutron names the PF
device RP in placement in an unexpected way. Therefore the test does not
need to mock anything in nova to simulate the same failure.

Change-Id: Ib72f15eb62fd50ea7117df577478f555a8478724
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger real BuildAbortException during migrate with bandwidth

The functional test
test_migrate_server_with_qos_port_pci_update_fail_not_reschedule used
fault injection to simulate that the
_update_pci_request_spec_with_allocated_interface_name call raises
BuildAbortException during migrating a instance with an SRIOV port
having resource request.

We can do a bit better. This patch simulates that neutron names the PF
device RP in placement in an unexpected way. Therefore the test does not
need to mock anything in nova to simulate the same failure.

Change-Id: Ib72f15eb62fd50ea7117df577478f555a8478724
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

(1 comment)

Thank you very much for your quick review, Rajat Dhasmana.

 > Deprecated options can still be used,
 > could you explain the functionality when nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont
 > is set in conf?
 > like `nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont=1`
When the option is set, the driver selects given number of portals from available portals.
For example, when the option is set to 1 and 4 portals per controller are available, the driver selects 1 portal from each controller.
NEC Storage has 1 or 2 controllers and each controller has up to 12 portals (ports).
On NEC Storage, users can configure which portals to be available (accessible) for each server (initiator).
When the option is set to 0, the driver tries to return all available portals, and database field overflow occurs in old implementation.'}, {'account_id': 28403, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Sorry, I missed reply message.

> Deprecated options can still be used,
> could you explain the functionality when nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont
> is set in conf?
> like `nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont=1`

When the option is set, the driver selects given number of portals
from available portals.
For example, when the option is set to 1 and 4 portals per
controller are available, the driver selects 1 portal from each
controller.
NEC Storage has 1 or 2 controllers and each controller has up to 12
portals (ports).
On NEC Storage, users can configure which portals to be available
(accessible) for each server (initiator).
When the option is set to 0, the driver tries to return all
available portals, and database field overflow occurs in old
implementation.'}, {'account_id': 20284, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-28 05:33:11.000000000', 'message': 'NEC Driver: allow more than 4 iSCSI portals

NEC driver currently does not allow more than 4 iSCSI portals for
a node.
The driver passes portal IQNs from create_export() and
create_export_snapshot() to initialize_connection() using
provider_location.
The length of provider_location is defined as varchar 256 in DB scheme.
It may be insufficient to store more than 4 portal IQN strings.

If more than 4 portals are available for a node, the driver selects
2 or 4 of them in multipath.
The number of portals selected is configurable with
nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont parameter.

This patch removes the limit by avoiding using provider_location.
It moves entire process in create_export() and create_export_snapshot()
to initialize_connection() so that the driver can have IQNs of all
available portals in initialize_connection() without passing them.

This patch also deletes nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont config option.
The option is used to limit number of portals and is no longer needed
for the driver.
Users still can limit number of portals for a node (initiator) with
NEC Storage Manager.

Change-Id: I325e32b834d41e0ed53a11b143e4617b12cdd769

commit_message:
NEC Driver: allow more than 4 iSCSI portals

NEC driver currently does not allow more than 4 iSCSI portals for
a node.
The driver passes portal IQNs from create_export() and
create_export_snapshot() to initialize_connection() using
provider_location.
The length of provider_location is defined as varchar 256 in DB scheme.
It may be insufficient to store more than 4 portal IQN strings.

If more than 4 portals are available for a node, the driver selects
2 or 4 of them in multipath.
The number of portals selected is configurable with
nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont parameter.

This patch removes the limit by avoiding using provider_location.
It moves entire process in create_export() and create_export_snapshot()
to initialize_connection() so that the driver can have IQNs of all
available portals in initialize_connection() without passing them.

This patch also deprecated nec_iscsi_portals_per_cont config option.
The option is used to limit number of portals and is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I325e32b834d41e0ed53a11b143e4617b12cdd769

commit_message:
Don't allow mixing IPv4/IPv6 configuration

OVN doesn't support members with different IP version
that loadalancer VIP. We should block such operations.

Change-Id: Id193385866cfb5f2490e3e322fc79a1fae81fd72
Closes-Bug: #1843553

commit_message:
Restore nova-key tag

The nova-key tag is used to create and update SSH keys and
authorized keys among nova compute hosts. The execution
of this task isolated is a standard administrative task
to isolate and contain change to the minimum necessary activites.

Change-Id: I65d342b83649c626295c28096b3bb7c19e837fa9
(cherry picked from commit 71fdf84eb3fccea6ce08b6875107980e64613313)

subject: Make patrole-member-stein non-voting
messages:
[{'account_id': 23140, 'date': '2019-07-19 22:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-07-22 23:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for taking the initiative to fix these failures. But the right way to avoid failing this job is to add a feature flag to tests like:

* test_update_network_provider_physical_network
* test_update_network_provider_segmentation_id

Example: https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/c8246e66e45a710e3c4ef427eeef845b71dd343f/devstack/plugin.sh#L59

That skips them if stein is enabled.

But I suspect the best way is to simply fix the above two tests (or as a last resort remove them if they are no longer applicable). Skipping the entire job to get around the fact that these 2 tests are the problematic ones is not the right approach. We should keep this as voting.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-10 13:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Thanks for taking the initiative to fix these failures. But the
 > right way to avoid failing this job is to add a feature flag to
 > tests like:
 > 
 > * test_update_network_provider_physical_network
 > * test_update_network_provider_segmentation_id
 > 
 > Example: https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/c8246e66e45a710e3c4ef427eeef845b71dd343f/devstack/plugin.sh#L59
 > 
 > That skips them if stein is enabled.
 > 
 > But I suspect the best way is to simply fix the above two tests (or
 > as a last resort remove them if they are no longer applicable).
 > Skipping the entire job to get around the fact that these 2 tests
 > are the problematic ones is not the right approach. We should keep
 > this as voting.

+1 let's fix the test via feature flag instead of job."}, {'account_id': 23140, 'date': '2019-09-19 17:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

makes it non-voting until it can be removed or fixed.

Change-Id: I3ed450ab312af81c057659f47f1ba0241d6aad23

commit_message:
Support direct provisioning of bare metal

If `baremetal_provision` is `true`, deploy baremetal with "openstack
overcloud node provision" and deployed-server, instead of with
heat/nova.

Change-Id: I57893a64f4c3224ffe8bd12330f12bd9d3cbbf89
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Add info log about ready DHCP config for ports

DHCP agent sends to neutron-server information about
ports for which DHCP configration is finished.
There was no logged any information about ports which
has got finished this DHCP ports configuration.

This patch adds such log with INFO level. It is the same as
it is currently done in e.g. neutron-ovs-agent.

Change-Id: I9506f855af118bbbd45b55a711504d6ad0f863cc
(cherry picked from commit 63671411553fe5db474ebc8549bb96f34d32e805)

Add info log about ready DHCP config for ports

DHCP agent sends to neutron-server information about
ports for which DHCP configration is finished.
There was no logged any information about ports which
has got finished this DHCP ports configuration.

This patch adds such log with INFO level. It is the same as
it is currently done in e.g. neutron-ovs-agent.

Nova ditto.

commit_message:
restart cinder and nova container if ceph changed

Restart cinder container if ceph's configuration changed when
using kolla-ansible -i multinode -t cinder reconfigure.
Nova ditto.

Change-Id: I0bf3b47cc4d46cfa274b338dcda0bed65e5f869a
Closes-Bug: #1743285

There's some really good work in this patch, thanks for the hard work. 

Unfortunately there is too much cross over with the existing tests as Jeffrey has highlighted. Are the existing ones really functional and these unit or are is the reality that they are both a hybrid? One or more of the following needs to happen here:

* Detail how these differ to tests/test_build.py
* If they don't differ, merge them with the existing
* If they do, we need unit/functional directories for a more workable split"}, {'account_id': 13747, 'date': '2016-04-13 06:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

The unittest code is different from the existing testcode.

The existing testcode will read file from disks, for example Dockerfile. But in the PS, it never touch the disk. All thing will be mocks. It never read file from disks. And in the PS, there are unit test for every function.

I am not sure the existing should be consider as function test. In WorkerThreadTest, it only mock the docker client. Should it be consider as function test?'}, {'account_id': 13747, 'date': '2016-04-14 02:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-04-14 02:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified-1

Kuo,

the unit test and function test are not divided by whether they
touch the disk file. 

They are divided by what are you testing.
when you test a method/function, add mock something it depend, it
is unittest, like yours and the current unittest in the kolla/tests
When you test a whole functional feature, it is function test.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-05-27 03:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

we have unittest file for build.py in <kolla>/kolla/tests/test_build.py [0].
then why we need a separate file (<kolla>/kolla/tests/unit/test_kolla_build.py)
like your PS?

I think one file is OK. these two files are doing the same things. There is no
need to have these two files.

So, please move your tests to the test_build.py files


[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/kolla/tests/test_build.py'}, {'account_id': 13747, 'date': '2016-05-27 06:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-27 07:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Verified+1

Create openvswitch-vswichd/db-server for individual fake nova compute

In emulation setup, each emulated nova-compute container should have
its own neutron agent and openvswitch containers.

subject: Restart heka container after config change
messages:
[{'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:39:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

'kolla-ansible reconfigure' should be doing this already. Also is the bug ref correct?"}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Paul,

kolla-ansible reconfigure is not restarting heka container after config change because of this I have added it in config. 
Bug ref is correct, LP link: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1571434'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:47:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Kibana is not able to configure index pattern because 'log-*' index is not getting created in elasticsearch."}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There must be a reason the do_reconfigure is not working for you though, have you checked? Otherwise we are duplicating logic'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-06 11:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

after reconfigure I am getting below log for 'Checking the heka config' task:

TASK: [common | Checking the heka config] *************************************
ok: [localhost] => {"changed": false, "cmd": ["docker", "exec", "heka", "/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs", "--check"], "delta": "0:00:04.499615", "end": "2016-05-06 17:25:07.458992", "failed": false, "failed_when_result": false, "rc": 0, "start": "2016-05-06 17:25:02.959377", "stderr": "INFO:__main__:Loading config file at /var/lib/kolla/config_files/config.json\nINFO:__main__:Validating config file\nINFO:__main__:Dest file does not exist, but is optional: /etc/heka/heka-swift-account-auditor.toml", "stdout": "", "stdout_lines": []}

Here "rc" is 0,

And heka container gets restarted if rc == 1  (https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/ansible/roles/common/tasks/do_reconfigure.yml#L42)'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2016-05-06 13:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-06 14:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2016-05-06 14:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What I'm trying to figure out is why in that case kolla_set_configs is not picking up the change.

Could you try changing this line:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/base/set_configs.py#L221

from "return" to "continue" and see if that does the trick?'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-10 07:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Paul,

I have changed "return" to "continue" as per your comment in  execute_config_check method (https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/docker/base/set_configs.py#L221).
With this change heka container is getting restarted if there is change in config.

But When I enable 'enable_central_logging' and do 'kolla-ansible reconfigure', elasticsearch and kibana containers are not getting started.
Elasticsearch and kibana reconfigure.yml files are empty (https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/ansible/roles/elasticsearch/tasks/reconfigure.yml).'}, {'account_id': 8300, 'date': '2016-05-10 13:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-10 13:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-06 11:30:04.000000000', 'message': 'Restart heka container after config change

After enabling central_logging in already deployed system,
heka container is not getting restarted. Because of this
logs are not getting indexed to elasticsearch.

Restarting heka container only when heka config has changed
and heka container is in running state.

Change-Id: I0e0b4bf00c6186cad5e74edf9ef6c5e0fae07341
Closes-Bug: #1571434
'}]
commit_message:
Restart heka container after config change

After enabling central_logging in already deployed system,
heka container is not getting restarted. Because of this
logs are not getting indexed to elasticsearch.

Restarting heka container only when heka config has changed
and heka container is in running state.

Change-Id: I0e0b4bf00c6186cad5e74edf9ef6c5e0fae07341
Closes-Bug: #1571434

- gate-kolla-dsvm-build-oraclelinux-binary http://logs.openstack.org/08/346008/2/check/gate-kolla-dsvm-build-oraclelinux-binary/29f357f/ : SUCCESS in 58m 00s (non-voting)
- gate-kolla-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-binary http://logs.openstack.org/08/346008/2/check/gate-kolla-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-binary/380f3ed/ : SUCCESS in 40m 02s (non-voting)
- gate-kolla-dsvm-build-oraclelinux-source http://logs.openstack.org/08/346008/2/check/gate-kolla-dsvm-build-oraclelinux-source/675f450/ : SUCCESS in 32m 31s (non-voting)
- gate-kolla-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-source http://logs.openstack.org/08/346008/2/check/gate-kolla-dsvm-deploy-oraclelinux-source/899b0c7/ : SUCCESS in 40m 53s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-22 13:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

1. this role should be create in the keystone role, because only the keystone use require user.
2. why not use the default _member_ role? it is well known by the users/operators.'}, {'account_id': 17938, 'date': '2016-07-22 14:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> 1. this role should be create in the keystone role, because only
 > the keystone use require user.
 > 2. why not use the default _member_ role? it is well known by the
 > users/operators.

Hi Jeffrey, I dont completely understand your reponse 1. I think his idea was that the creation of that keystone role is part of the bootstrapping that needs to be done for Keystone to be fully functional in the stack. Without an unprivileged role, we cannot assign any users to projects.

I believe the name "user" was chosen over "_member_" because the most recent installation guide for OpenStack suggests it: http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-ubuntu/keystone-users.html I also believe that at some point it was agreed to use "user" instead of "_member_" in the community.'}, {'account_id': 22874, 'date': '2016-07-22 15:03:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 1. this role should be create in the keystone role, because only
 > the keystone use require user.
 > 2. why not use the default _member_ role? it is well known by the
 > users/operators.

Hi Jeffrey,
I thought of kolla-toolbox as an alternative way or place for the role creation, but at the end I decided to add this as a part of the bootstrapping process because it was the more obvious solution for me. What's your opinion?"}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-26 14:34:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think we should

1. add the role in the horizon's role, because only the horizon need this role.
2. why not try to use the ansible module os_user_role to create this role in ansibe"}, {'account_id': 22874, 'date': '2016-07-27 10:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Jeffrey, 

1. I can't agree with your argument that only horizon needs this role. The "user" role is needed in order to assign it to the tenants and projects in general.
2. The ansible module os_user_role is used for role assignment, so it's not intended for role creation. My intention was just to create the role "user" by default.'}, {'account_id': 14103, 'date': '2016-07-27 14:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-28 15:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

still -1

1. my bad, you should use this http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/os_keystone_role_module.html , which can add/remove role in keystone.

2. The _member_ role is used in the keystone for really. if you create user by command line, use can exist without any role. Or I the assign the `admin` role to the user. the admin user and other service user is the case.'}, {'account_id': 17938, 'date': '2016-07-29 11:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> still -1
 > 
 > 1. my bad, you should use this http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/os_keystone_role_module.html
 > , which can add/remove role in keystone.
 > 
 > 2. The _member_ role is used in the keystone for really. if you
 > create user by command line, use can exist without any role. Or I
 > the assign the `admin` role to the user. the admin user and other
 > service user is the case.

Hi Jeffrey, of course, a user can exist without any role. But that user is completely useless then. 

 > still -1
 > 
 > 1. my bad, you should use this http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/os_keystone_role_module.html
 > , which can add/remove role in keystone.
 > 
 > 2. The _member_ role is used in the keystone for really. if you
 > create user by command line, use can exist without any role. Or I
 > the assign the `admin` role to the user. the admin user and other
 > service user is the case.

I don't get your point Jeffery. Of course, a user can exist without a role and the admin role creation is taken care of. But without a non-admin role like "user" we cannot have any tenants in our cloud. Good to have service users and admins, but in the end we want people to be able to use the cloud, no?

About the os_keystone_role ansible module: Are we using this way of creating entites anywhere else? If not, this would be an entirely new way. Is this the path we want to follow now?'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-29 18:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

talked with sdake in irc, the details please refer to the irclogs[0]. we are agree with

* the `user`/`_member_` user should be created in keystone role, because it is only use in horizon
* we perfer to use _member_ role rather than user role.
* this fix should split into two(maybe three), one for keystone_keystone_role module, another for keystone role created.
* all these fix should be backport to liberty and mitaka


[0]'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-30 06:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

sorry, the log link is: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-kolla/%23openstack-kolla.2016-07-29.log.html#t2016-07-29T16:55:13'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-07-30 14:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

see this fix.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-08-02 03:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the fix link is here: https://review.openstack.org/349198'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-03 13:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Keystone "user" role added by default.

The role "user" is added during keystone bootstrap
and it is configured as the default role in Horizon.

Change-Id: I166ef5d4fa75ca93d3e60c8ab002546cf141d4c1
Closes-Bug: #1604710

commit_message:
[WIP] Drop root for ceph containers

Updates to ensure commands run in the ceph containers
are done as the 'ceph' user rather than root.

Change-Id: I7715a2a40df673999284698ccf6f9272ffeb29de
Closes-Bug:#1553515

default_*_interface options were introduced in order to fix problem
with *_interface vars specification made in inventory file.

commit_message:
Fixing kolla's problem with ansible var precedence

default_*_interface options were introduced in order to fix problem
with *_interface vars specification made in inventory file.

Change-Id: I516c0df385d082607238589f68e2929434d961a3
Closes-Bug: #1604129
Closes-Bug: #1586524

[{'created': '2016-11-08 14:29:23.000000000', 'message': 'Missing customization of tenant network

This patch:
 . allows to specify a type of a tenant network
 . adds VLAN tenant type support

Changes:
ansible/group_vars/all.yml: add new variables for tenant type and VLAN
 . neutron_tenant_type -- sets tenant type
 . neutron_vlan_physnet -- sets name of VLAN network
 . neutron_vlan_range -- sets range for VLAN IDs
 . neutron_vlan_bridge -- sets bridge name for VLAN network
 . neutron_vlan_interface -- sets link name that will be added to VLAN bridge

ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/start.yml: add a task for creating a VLAN bridge

ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2: fix template to support VLAN

To deploy OpenStack with VLAN as a tenant mechanism the following variables
have to be set:
neutron_tenant_type: "vlan"
neutron_vlan_physnet: "any_name_other_than_physnet1"
neutron_vlan_interface: "link_name_of_data_network"

Change-Id: Ib0d6214fa87f271e8e5be597d6adfe76aa40d5a0
Closes-Bug: #1640183

commit_message:
Missing customization of tenant network

This patch:
 . allows to specify a type of a tenant network
 . adds VLAN tenant type support

Changes:
ansible/group_vars/all.yml: add new variables for tenant type and VLAN
 . neutron_tenant_type -- sets tenant type
 . neutron_vlan_physnet -- sets name of VLAN network
 . neutron_vlan_range -- sets range for VLAN IDs
 . neutron_vlan_bridge -- sets bridge name for VLAN network
 . neutron_vlan_interface -- sets link name that will be added to VLAN bridge

ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/start.yml: add a task for creating a VLAN bridge

ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2: fix template to support VLAN

To deploy OpenStack with VLAN as a tenant mechanism the following variables
have to be set:
neutron_tenant_type: "vlan"
neutron_vlan_physnet: "any_name_other_than_physnet1"
neutron_vlan_interface: "link_name_of_data_network"

Change-Id: Ib0d6214fa87f271e8e5be597d6adfe76aa40d5a0
Closes-Bug: #1640183

commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in
unit testtest methods can pass if we use method CONF.set_override
without parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option.

This commit makes sure calling method CONF.set_override
with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: I830114564ef546b521ee408be146c862af58c4da
Closes-Bug: #1517839

Are you sure? I deployed ceph-mon on nodes without glance-api, nova-api and cinder-api and for me it works like expected.'}, {'account_id': 21413, 'date': '2016-10-11 08:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kolla version: stable/mitaka
Ceph deploy success, but glance, nova, cinder failed.
the "add service/endpoint task" and "create database task" are also skipping, can't be executed.'}, {'account_id': 21413, 'date': '2016-10-11 08:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Christian Berendt, how are you!
Are you set enable_cinder and enable_glance and enable_nova equals yes, if set yes, i think, cinder, glance, nova also deployed fail'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2016-10-11 09:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I deploy glance + nova and set the corresponding variables to yes. I deploy the ceph_mon services not on the controller nodes (glance-api and nova-api are running on the controller nodes).'}, {'account_id': 21413, 'date': '2016-10-11 09:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, how surprised!
Can you give me your inventory file(only glance, nova, ceph-mon) and
the deploy log on "Creating the Glance service and endpoint" task?'}, {'account_id': 21413, 'date': '2016-10-11 10:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Let's do code review, such as glance and the "Creating the Glance service and endpoint" task.

First, see https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/stable/mitaka/ansible/site.yml#L80,
this task will be executed on ceph-mon.

Second, see https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/stable/mitaka/ansible/roles/glance/tasks/deploy.yml#L9
because ceph-mon host doesn't in groups['glance-api'],so it skipping.

Third. see https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/stable/mitaka/ansible/roles/glance/tasks/register.yml#L19
because this task only run once and it skipping previously, so this task can't be executed for ever.

The deploy process log as just analyze above in my local environment.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-11 10:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

[{'created': '2016-10-11 08:41:27.000000000', 'message': "Make ceph monitor nodes deploy separately

When deploy cinder, glance, nova with ceph, if one monitor node doesn't
on groups['glance-api'] or groups['nova-api'] or groups['cinder-api'],
it will deploy fail, because the relative task skipping, and the task
is set to run only once, it leads to this task can't be executed for ever.

Change-Id: If1b63b7553e66523d14ce242e0afcd525b30c0b9
Closes-Bug: #1631861
"}]
commit_message:
Make ceph monitor nodes deploy separately

When deploy cinder, glance, nova with ceph, if one monitor node doesn't
on groups['glance-api'] or groups['nova-api'] or groups['cinder-api'],
it will deploy fail, because the relative task skipping, and the task
is set to run only once, it leads to this task can't be executed for ever.

Change-Id: If1b63b7553e66523d14ce242e0afcd525b30c0b9
Closes-Bug: #1631861

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-03 17:25:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update the cleanup-host script for swift cleanup.

When the destroy role is run against nodes, logic is included to
do cleanup for swift (similar to ceph). However, as the
swift_devices_mount_point may vary, the copy task takes care of
appending to the cleanup-host script as needed.

Change-Id: I5d7193e1bad60396b03758b342f99f7eaedde052
Closes-Bug: #1638989
'}]
commit_message:
Update the cleanup-host script for swift cleanup.

When the destroy role is run against nodes, logic is included to
do cleanup for swift (similar to ceph). However, as the
swift_devices_mount_point may vary, the copy task takes care of
appending to the cleanup-host script as needed.

Change-Id: I5d7193e1bad60396b03758b342f99f7eaedde052
Closes-Bug: #1638989

commit_message:
Steps to add vnic interface

contains steps required to add veth pair and use one end of veth
pair as a second interface for deployment.
Closes-Bug: 1514227

Change-Id: I35ec6741f0a5305237bdd8a797e09ebfa29a9cc2

commit_message:
user wont be associated to project if ldap is keystone backend

As per the code in the kolla-toolbox only when user is created then
user will be associated to the project with the specific role
given in the command. When we use ldap as backend, user is already
present so it wont get associated to project provided.

Change-Id: I6214b94adb01a6fcecf94b62d8a041f16162d4ec
Closes-Bug: #1653501

commit_message:
In kubernetes ovs and l3 agents need to run as root

In kubernetes communication between ovsdb and neutron-openvswitch-agent
as well as l3 agent happens over db.sock named socket. When the socket
gets created neutron user cannot access due to the rights restrictions.
It applied ONLY to kubernetes environment.

Closes-Bug: #1614489

Change-Id: I1dec04ef13d25a1c9804e22b9ed37f8d2db7fa75

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Online Db sync have to be executed only when control plane
services are upgraded. In order to have ability to execute
online db sync directly via helm chart by modifying
manifest:nova_db_sync_onlune true|false during upgrade, move
it to own job.

'}]
commit_message:
[Nova] Move online db sync to separate job

Online Db sync have to be executed only when control plane
services are upgraded. In order to have ability to execute
online db sync directly via helm chart by modifying
manifest:nova_db_sync_onlune true|false during upgrade, move
it to own job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681476/
Change-Id: I8d60f52dfaec03586311c4e02c1bbce87b239abc

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Changes include modification of path to /etc/kolla/nova-compute
as it contains the nova.conf file for compute configuration.
Closes-Bug: 1652213

commit_message:
Update configuration of Telegraf retention_policy

The name of "default" retention policy does not exists;
the default setting is retention_policy = "".
when finish it,the data can be writen in influxdb.

Closes-Bug:#1673914

Change-Id: I82b19fa53bedb3576e2891359dddabbbedb8587d

commit_message:
Dependency fixes for bifrost image.

Added iptables package and removed the PyPI MySQL-python package
which is broken following the sed command being ran from the
bifrost-base image on Debian-based distros, so needs to be
re-installed by bifrost itself during its install plays.

Change-Id: Idcf76cf90658f767df5005999e51a1e0f41ced63
Closes-Bug: #1673420

Well executed after the modification in my enviroment, 
and expect more suitable solution.
