Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-19 04:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Fix Bootstraping the mongodb replication set

update this bindIp to the storage_interface

Closes-Bug: #1626339

Change-Id: I452ea08d840333434f283768445cfd8e22228d9e
Signed-off-by: zhangkun <refrain@139.com>

subject: Add storage interface address

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-15 18:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add storage interface address

In globals.yml, if storage_interface is different from others interfaces
(for dedicated network by example),
so it's impossible to attache a volume to a VM.

Tgtd listen to api_interface and nova compute try to connect the iscsi
driver with a wrong address.

Creating a specific storage_address_interface in
configuration & variable files fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1651356

Change-Id: I79d0a6e77ee22e8423391c264a317d45763510f0

commit_message:
Fix Murano/RabbitMQ problem with haproxy

Murano make use of RabbitMQ as "message queue" service. In order to
implement this, we need:

 1. murano.conf: [rabbitmq] section must be defined into murano.conf
 2. haproxy container: haproxy.cfg must define a listener for rabbitmq
    connections in kolla_external_vip_address:rabbitmq_port
 3. vhost in rabbitmq server dedicated for murano clients

Change-Id: Icfba1a627a2ef282aeb0e7ac1768d2cb2e36d47f
Closes-Bug: #1634801

commit_message:
WIP: Enable Ceph input plugin in Telegraf

Monitoring Ceph cluster’s performance provides vital insights into how
the cluster performs in various situations.
It also allows to make rational decisions as regards capacity planning
and maintenance windows.

Change-Id: Ie839015254f0be7f67adeeebb2f560bd4d54ddd2
Closes-Bug: #1681714

commit_message:
Modify config.yml playbook for bifrost role

Add hostname of deployment host to /etc/hosts file

This is handed by bifrost
(https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/blob/master/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/bootstrap.yml)
but it fails when done inside a container.  The reason it fails is
because Docker bind mounts /etc/hosts into the container from a volume.
This prevents atomic renames which will prevent ansible from fixing the
/etc/hosts file automatically inside the container.

Change-Id: I27fef058fae85ca33c1ccfa2870b67a733aa6650
Closes-Bug: #1661009

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

[{'created': '2017-02-09 07:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Wrong type of interface in mongodb bootstrap_cluster.js template

Mongodb binds to api_interface. This template is used during task "Bootstraping the mongodb replication set" whenever api_interface!=storage_interface it fails because mongodb container doesn't listen on this storage_interface.

Change-Id: I8a30b653600317f316bd128c526200f522e22cda
Closes-Bug: 1663128
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong type of interface in mongodb bootstrap_cluster.js template

Mongodb binds to api_interface. This template is used during task "Bootstraping the mongodb replication set" whenever api_interface!=storage_interface it fails because mongodb container doesn't listen on this storage_interface.

Change-Id: I8a30b653600317f316bd128c526200f522e22cda
Closes-Bug: 1663128

commit_message:
Make ceph pool sizes configurable

Default stays 128 as it was before.

Change-Id: I474139533ad4a98731b6b68e063662f6818bbd5f
Closes-Bug: #1629338

commit_message:
Install docker_client and groupadd

In order to collect Docker metrics with Telegraf,
Follow the steps below:
1.install docker_client in telegraf container(kolla)
2.Add the telegraf to the docker group(kolla)
3.Add docker configuration to telegraf(kolla_ansible)

Change-Id: Ic2327f61284b2f1e7faa377d2d5c31336151c684
Closes-Bug: 1635034

subject: Pg_num should be configurable

commit_message:
Pg_num should be configurable

Currently the pg_num is hard coded in the ansible role.
There sometimes is a need to choose this number based
on calculations. http://ceph.com/pgcalc/

Change-Id: I4bb7fe9ba5076df5c90a62383752cea7835c4eb0
Closes-Bug: #1662640

Just tried cherry-picking this patch and found that it does not work with the kolla-ansible upgrade command because the register.yml task file is not included, so the trustee_domain variable is never registered.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-05-02 18:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I used the following patch (based on this one) to ocata: https://github.com/stackhpc/kolla-ansible/commit/e2233ccfa13e6c15bf95e67c66352920d6393608. It avoids the issue with the upgrade command by querying the domain ID if it is not already set.

It looks like the magnum_trustee_domain_id variable is no longer set in register.yml in the master branch, so this would need to be reinstated if this patch were to be applied to master.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-05-09 10:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Agree with Mark, this will fail on upgrades'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-05-09 10:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-06-02 09:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2017-06-21 10:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-21 11:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add trustee_domain_id in magnum.conf

Set the magnum keystone domain ID in magnum.conf. Without this config
option set, magnum deployments fail.

Change-Id: Ibfdc8e7a91768472ac4824b167985aa4bdccdd1d
Closes-Bug: #1674894
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc>

commit_message:
Make endpoint and database address separately

Under certain conditions, it should use company mysql service instead
of default mariadb container.
But the endponit address and database address are also reference to the
kolla_internal_fqdn value.
It may not consider the endpoint service and database service are not on
the same host, they may be separately on different host.

Change-Id: I194d601e6aa51345d3098b34cfa1a3defe1fb44b
Closes-Bug: #1588164

commit_message:
Fix Nova boot on Ubuntu with hardware acceleration

On Ubuntu|Debian if virt_type is set to kvm (default value),
Nova boot actually fails.
This patch fix it by adding qemu-kvm package to nova-libvirt Docker
images.

Closes-Bug: #1699712
Change-Id: Ifaab329e186746ea4d2d4c554ffdd3ca923279ad

consider this, should we still want to add the network-ovn now?
the OVS is experimental[0].

> Open vSwitch (OVS) includes OVN beginning with version 2.5 and considers it **experimental**. The Networking service integration for OVN uses an independent package, typically networking-ovn.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/master/doc/source/install.rst#packaging'}, {'account_id': 16993, 'date': '2016-05-12 13:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi, Jeffrey, is that document outdated? OVN stays in the master branch with openvswitch.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2016-05-17 20:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

hi this appears to be a duplicate of https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1538142
which i previously proposed last cycle to build
ovs from source for supporting dpdk and potentially ovn at a later date.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275932/

my understanding was that the source build was restricted to only python services and not infrastructure components.

if this is merged i would like to make sure that it can also allow for the case where we can build ovs with dpdk also.

if your change is accepted i will submit a follow up change for extending this to also support ovs with dpdk however think this first needs to be discussed within kolla regarding extending source build to include non python components. 

in general i am in favor of this change but the benefits have to be weighed against supporting the c tool chain.'}, {'account_id': 16993, 'date': '2016-05-24 08:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 21061, 'date': '2016-06-14 23:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

A point to consider is how to handle openvswitch kernel module. It might be needed to build openvswitch.ko together with the rest of openvswitch from source (because of bugfixes, new features, compatibility, whatever).

However this can't be done in "image build" phase, because kernel sources in version of destination host are needed for that, and this is not known yet during build.

On the other hand, if "old" os-kernel openvswitch module is used/loaded on the target deployment host, newly built ovs may possibly not work with that.'}, {'account_id': 16993, 'date': '2016-06-16 00:57:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16993, 'date': '2016-06-16 01:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi, Martin, thanks for your comment. From my understanding, the database schema of OVSDB is pretty much backward compatible. But you are right, this is an issue.

Folks,
I would like to keep the PS alive for some time and see how it goes. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-16 01:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

As mentioned in my common on patch set 4, please make this optional. I do not want to build Open vSwitch (or any other infrastructure component) from source when using type = source. What about introduction a new configuration parameter infrastructure_type or something like this to be able to build infrastructure components from source or to install them from binary packages.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2016-06-18 11:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

there is also the issue here that the ovs clients will be different version in the ovs agent container as it will be using the ovs clinets form the package manager.

because of that build of ovs in source mode needs to be conditional.

maybe it would just be better to have a seperate ovn contaienr where you build ovs/ovn from souce and have it manage the package manager provided ovs instead of building ovs from source.

you can then use the exteranl customisation to override the ovs install if you really do want to build ovs from source.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-06-21 08:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

agreed with Chistian. I do not expect to install openvswitch
from source code even when the install_type is source.'}, {'account_id': 16993, 'date': '2016-06-22 14:29:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

So, I think the better solution is to create a separate OVN container built from source, rather than polluting the existing OVS container.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2016-06-23 02:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hui Kang wrote:

> So, I think the better solution is to create a separate OVN
> container built from source, rather than polluting the existing OVS
> container.

this is a little redundance, especially for the ansible task.

how about add follow config in kolla-build.conf

[openvswitch]
# binary is the default
install_type=source/binary
type=url
localtion=xxxx'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2016-07-01 01:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

if we support building ovs from source the
openvswitch-base container would have to inherit form openstack-base so that the openvswitch agent container could be based on the openvswitch-base image to have the same ovs client versions as server/db versions when ovn is not used.

without that change i think the separate container for ovn makes more sense.

by the way ovn is now available on ubuntu 14.04 in the mitaka cloud archive and on ubuntu 16.04 main archive so why does this still need to be built from source when it can be installed form the package manager?

the ovn componets are provided by ovn-host ovn-docker ovn-centeral and ovn-common'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-27 12:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

switch keystone_token_provider to use fernet

I76d5c29f6b1572ee3ec7f2b1af63ff31572de2ce so we are updating the
defaults.

Closes-bug: 1753574

commit_message:
Fix creation of vlan network with segmentation_id set to 0

In case when vlan network was created with segmentation_id=0 and without
physical_network given, it was passing validation of provider segment
and first available segmentation_id was choosen for network.
Problem was that in such case all available segmentation ids where
allocated and no other vlan network could be created later.

This patch fixes validation of segmentation_id when it is set to value 0.

Change-Id: Ic768deb84d544db832367f9a4b84a92729eee620
Closes-bug: #1840895
(cherry picked from commit f01f3ae5dd0dd7dd9aa513a1b50e04e20a08b97b)

commit_message:
Fix creation of vlan network with segmentation_id set to 0

In case when vlan network was created with segmentation_id=0 and without
physical_network given, it was passing validation of provider segment
and first available segmentation_id was choosen for network.
Problem was that in such case all available segmentation ids where
allocated and no other vlan network could be created later.

This patch fixes validation of segmentation_id when it is set to value 0.

Change-Id: Ic768deb84d544db832367f9a4b84a92729eee620
Closes-bug: #1840895
(cherry picked from commit f01f3ae5dd0dd7dd9aa513a1b50e04e20a08b97b)

commit_message:
Work around strptime threading issue

There is an open bug[1] in python strptime when used in multi-threaded
applications. We have seen this occur in the Octavia test jobs[2].
This patch works around the bug by loading strptime early.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue7980
[2] https://logs.opendev.org/37/673337/12/check/ \
    octavia-v2-act-stdby-iptables-dsvm-py2-scenario/440c965/controller/logs \
    /screen-o-cw.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Aug_09_23_54_29_426364

Change-Id: I932ad625595333e97b0ead074ce64a7341af338d
(cherry picked from commit 0720397d5c47e2af33dbe9fdf8f25b95ce620106)

commit_message:
Work around strptime threading issue

There is an open bug[1] in python strptime when used in multi-threaded
applications. We have seen this occur in the Octavia test jobs[2].
This patch works around the bug by loading strptime early.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue7980
[2] https://logs.opendev.org/37/673337/12/check/ \
    octavia-v2-act-stdby-iptables-dsvm-py2-scenario/440c965/controller/logs \
    /screen-o-cw.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Aug_09_23_54_29_426364

Change-Id: I932ad625595333e97b0ead074ce64a7341af338d
(cherry picked from commit 0720397d5c47e2af33dbe9fdf8f25b95ce620106)

commit_message:
Fix nova console variable mappings

Currently consoles are not being installed using pinned shas, instead
role defaults are being used, which installs a version of novnc
that is not compatible with the version of nova that we install.

The console mapping vars were removed in error by [1], so the os_nova
role default of "master" has been used for the novnc install branch
ever since.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/1f1cca42c5ade59aa73eaf30819ab76a0998c8b2#diff-3d229b9ce819915d3e9a8249b194b814

Change-Id: I66f3cf53b1185815900d55a2fd1a1e6827f87f39

[{'created': '2019-09-09 15:12:17.000000000', 'message': "Add idrac HW type support of Redfish interfaces

This change defines two new groups of interface implementations with
entrypoints named 'idrac-redfish' and 'idrac-wsman'. The 'idrac-redfish'
entrypoints refer to Redfish interface implementations which are
compatible with the Dell EMC integrated Dell Remote Access Controller
(iDRAC), presently those of the management and power hardware
interfaces. The 'idrac-wsman' entrypoints are new names for the legacy
'idrac' entrypoints.

The idrac hardware type declares support for those new interface
implementations, in addition to all interface implementations it has
been supporting. Default interface implementations are unaffected.

Story: 2004592
Task: 36275
Change-Id: I11f002eff78d27369b3dbe9a9fbd5fc73496a5eb
"}, {'created': '2019-09-10 23:14:01.000000000', 'message': "Add first idrac HW type Redfish interface support

entrypoints named 'idrac-redfish' and 'idrac-wsman'. The 'idrac-redfish'
entrypoints refer to interface implementations that utilize the Redfish
out-of-band (OOB) management protocol and are compatible with the
integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) baseboard management
controller (BMC), presently those of the management and power hardware
interfaces. The 'idrac-wsman' entrypoints are new names for the legacy
'idrac' entrypoints. They both use the Web Services Management (WS-Man)
OOB management protocol.

The idrac hardware type declares support for those new interface
implementations, in addition to all interface implementations it has
been supporting. The priority order of supported interfaces remains the

'idrac-wsman'.

commit_message:
Add first idrac HW type Redfish interface support

This change adds initial idrac hardware type support of interface
implementations that utilize the Redfish out-of-band (OOB) management
protocol and are compatible with the integrated Dell Remote Access
Controller (iDRAC) baseboard management controller (BMC), presently
those of the management and power hardware interfaces. They are named
'idrac-redfish'.

It also introduces a new name for the 'idrac' interface implementations,
'idrac-wsman', and deprecates 'idrac'. They both use the Web Services
Management (WS-Man) OOB management protocol.

The idrac hardware type declares support for those new interface
implementations, in addition to all interface implementations it has
been supporting. The priority order of supported interfaces remains the
same. Interface implementations which rely on WS-Man continue to have
the highest priority, and the new 'idrac-wsman' is listed before the
deprecated 'idrac'.

Story: 2004592
Task: 36275
Change-Id: I11f002eff78d27369b3dbe9a9fbd5fc73496a5eb

commit_message:
Set FW group admin-state UP by default

By default, the admin state of a new firwall group should be UP.
This patch mark the checkbox.

Change-Id: Id377c656788e0fbb13c4b8f90dd022e39c50adbf
Closes-bug: #1833374
(cherry picked from commit 1be0cfb10ede071a11963c3180da07f898e022d3)

commit_message:
renderspec: add conflict with old python 2.x version

They would conflict over the %bindir installed renderspec otherwise.
we need to express the conflict to pass openSUSE's staging checks.

Change-Id: I366938d822da9b63c0b53929ee10b2070770aec4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-21 11:51:31.000000000', 'message': "Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

Closes-Bug: #1752897
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 264c887f370fd6a6e0d6f0d65acdedc8cb53dd04)

"}, {'created': '2019-09-17 17:02:02.000000000', 'message': "Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

This changes squashes three commits:

1) Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

2) Fix bug migrating ACLs to Port Groups

When migrating to Port Groups, we were installing wrong ACLs
matching on old Address Sets. This was because, during migration
time, old Address Sets still existed in NB database and we
were relying on their existence to figure out which one to use.

This patch fixes it by simply picking the auto generated
Address Set if Port Groups is supported in the OVSDB schema.

3) Drop subnet Port Groups

This patch is dropping the code that creates and handles the
subnet Port Groups. Those were used to place the ACLs that
allowed DHCP traffic to reach the responder in the OVN
pipeline but as explained in the bug description, it's
not needed anymore.

Related-Bug: #1752897

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f01169b405bb5080a1bc1653f79512eb0664c35d)

3) Drop subnet Port Groups

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

This changes squashes three commits:

1) Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

2) Fix bug migrating ACLs to Port Groups

When migrating to Port Groups, we were installing wrong ACLs
matching on old Address Sets. This was because, during migration
time, old Address Sets still existed in NB database and we
were relying on their existence to figure out which one to use.

This patch fixes it by simply picking the auto generated
Address Set if Port Groups is supported in the OVSDB schema.

3) Drop subnet Port Groups

This patch is dropping the code that creates and handles the
subnet Port Groups. Those were used to place the ACLs that
allowed DHCP traffic to reach the responder in the OVN
pipeline but as explained in the bug description, it's
not needed anymore.

Related-Bug: #1752897

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Port Groups ACLs related code from ovsdbapp

This stable/queens-only patch adds three major changes taken from
ovsdbapp (matching branch).

1) Add Port_Group commands
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681657

2) Add Port Group ACL commands
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681658

3) Port Group's letfovers
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681659

Change-Id: I2a9a9dcdefe6e25bc789a6e588c585557b32c43e
Related-Bug: #1752897

Hit the following during a deployment:

"Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call
'length' parameter 'arg' expects a value of type Collection, String,
or Binary, got Undef"

This commit adds a safeguard to skip the length check if
$driver_devices is 'Undef'.

(cherry picked from commit ffdc816e37c7739e4645df08fac574859e2b06ac)

commit_message:
Safeguard against 'Undef' length() checks.

Hit the following during a deployment:

"Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call
'length' parameter 'arg' expects a value of type Collection, String,
or Binary, got Undef"

This commit adds a safeguard to skip the length check if
$driver_devices is 'Undef'.

Closes-bug: #1827091

Change-Id: Ide850ab917736f066c38e2e55960a03e1fcd3523
(cherry picked from commit ffdc816e37c7739e4645df08fac574859e2b06ac)

subject: Fix the undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass error seen with ovs 2.10
messages: [{'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-19 08:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-19 08:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1789236-stable/rocky-stable/queens to bug/1789236-stable/queens'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-19 09:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-19 13:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-19 08:03:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix the undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass error seen with ovs 2.10

puppet-ovn uses puppet-vswitch to configure the OVN params. When OVS binaries are
compiled with dpdk support and when vs_config provider runs the command
'ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch .', the below warning messages are seen and
are part of the command output.

----
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot load glue library: libibverbs.so.1: cannot open shared
object file: No such file or directory
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot initialize PMD due to missing run-time dependency on
rdma-core libraries (libibverbs, libmlx5)
----

We see the error 'undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass' when the result is
extracted. This patch fixes this issue by checking if the 'value' var is nil or
not before 'parse_column_value' is called.

Tripleo deployment with OVN is failing because of this issue.

Change-Id: I415a6229a0fbc1b55451e3738539735afdc6f8f4
Closes-bug: #1789236
(cherry picked from commit 757c3a333115e6bd29bf0274ee8582989697793b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass error seen with ovs 2.10

puppet-ovn uses puppet-vswitch to configure the OVN params. When OVS binaries are
compiled with dpdk support and when vs_config provider runs the command
'ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch .', the below warning messages are seen and
are part of the command output.

----
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot load glue library: libibverbs.so.1: cannot open shared
object file: No such file or directory
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot initialize PMD due to missing run-time dependency on
rdma-core libraries (libibverbs, libmlx5)
----

We see the error 'undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass' when the result is
extracted. This patch fixes this issue by checking if the 'value' var is nil or
not before 'parse_column_value' is called.

Tripleo deployment with OVN is failing because of this issue.

Change-Id: I415a6229a0fbc1b55451e3738539735afdc6f8f4
Closes-bug: #1789236
(cherry picked from commit 757c3a333115e6bd29bf0274ee8582989697793b)

commit_message:
Add support for systemd

Systemd support is in corosync, but currently the add_init_service
handles adding an upstart service only. This results in Charmed
Kubernetes having incorrectly monitored services.

Change-Id: I935613292ce6b78cf645469fda6d21b0aa695c28
Closes-Bug: #1843933

commit_message:
Check for VT in nova prechecks when using KVM

If the user has set nova_compute_virt_type to kvm, we should check
whether Virtualisation Technology (VT) has been enabled in the
BIOS during nova prechecks, since creation of VMs will fail without
this.

This code has been adapted from openstack-ansible-os_nova:
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/src/branch/master/tasks/nova_virt_detect.yml

Change-Id: I2f0f9a7dff3fe6321e3f123b06f5ae883722deda
Closes-Bug: #1844669

messages:
[{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-09-16 09:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-09-16 09:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-09-16 13:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-16 13:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-17 01:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+2

Glad you caught this, Abhishek!'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-17 12:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Based on the "independent" library status of glance_store I'm wondering if we should remove the registering of those stores from there rather than from glance. It's really glance, not glance_store that needs them.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-09-17 13:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Erno we cannot register these options here as we need these stores in global map defined by glance_store. The store object is stored in global map while initialising the store options.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-17 13:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, Abhishek introduced the concept of "reserved" stores into glance_store.  So the library is actually handling the general case by finding the reserved stores in the config, registering their options, and creating them.  In other words, a glance_store consumer other than glance can do the same thing if it requires reserved stores.  So basically, the library consumer declares what stores it needs and what they should look like in its configuration file; glance_store reads that file and does the work.

In case that paragraph got too long, I think everything is happening in the appropriate place.  I shouldn't have registered the options on the glance side in my patch creating the sample config for the reserved stores.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-19 09:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Discussed about this with Abhishek. Looking at the code this makes sense now and indeed this double registration was missed during the original review.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-19 09:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

woops. Lets check this once more to make sure we do it right.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-19 11:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Lets revert the original patch and do this right.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-09-19 15:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We are reverting the base patches which is causing this issue and going to fix it in the glance_store itself.'}]

commit_message:
Avoid duplication of registering reserved_store options

glance_store library already has ability to register config options for
reserved_stores. The commit [0] was added to include reserved_stores option
in sample configuration files, but it is also registering those options while
doing so.

Removed the part of registering the reserved store options.

Change-Id: Ida08bcdad3bcff73c0bd81c8e0cbe344e2036f32
Closes-Bug: #1844108

commit_message:
Optimize creation of language specs

* Various simple optimizations for creation of specs. Mostly
  additional caching of non-growing data related to the
  structure of the language spec classes. For huge workflows
  with thousands of tasks these changes reduce execution time
  by dozens of seconds.
* Minor style changes.

Partial-bug: #1844242
Change-Id: Ia700e25752d9d35ece18609f2977e6568062e4bf

commit_message:
Add build_active_retries and port_detach_timeout

Parameter build_active_retries sets retry threshold for waiting for a
build slot for an amphorae.

Parameter port_detach_timeout sets seconds to wait for a port to detach
from an amphora

Change-Id: I5e2d2db8e7113e0c50b7cbd6a7ed383492477180

messages:
[{'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-23 15:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-23 15:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-23 16:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-23 19:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-24 07:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

To test:
1. change keystone.conf to set change_password_upon_first_use = true
2. as an admin, change the password of your test user
3. try to log in as that test user
You should be redirected to a password change page.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-07-24 07:47:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have no idea why the integration tests are failing. They are openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.tests.test_instances.TestInstances.test_create_delete_instance and openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests.tests.test_router.TestRouters.test_router_overview_data both failing with "selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: POST /session/cae982aa-331e-4edd-8f04-c689834404fc/log did not match a known command". I tested those views manually and didn't see anything out of order. Of course my code changes shouldn't change anything in those views.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-07-25 14:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you add unit tests?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-05 09:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-05 10:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-20 10:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:52:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-08-27 09:59:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi @radomir,
I have applied your patch in my local env. and it successfully redirects me to 'Change password' page but I am not able to update the password for new user and getting an error 'Unable to update the user password'.
I have followed the same steps as mentioned here https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1791111 by Lance.

Are you able to change the password for the new user?
I don't know what I am missing?"}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-27 12:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

@vishal I did test it on my packstack environment. Do you have anything in the horizon or keystone logs? Do you have the password regexp set, perhaps?'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-08-27 12:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Also, are you able to change the password from the command line for that user?'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-08-27 18:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Also, are you able to change the password from the command line for
 > that user?

yeah, I am able to change the password from CLI for that user.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-12 08:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-12 08:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I addressed the merge conflict caused by the recent changes.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-12 09:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-12 09:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I see a confusing behavior with this patch. See below.

----

I set [security_compliance] change_password_upon_first_use = True in keystone.conf (and restarted keystone) and then tested your patch.
I confirmed the feature worked well in DevStack.
A new user succeeded to change his password and logged into the dashboard with the new password.

However, I see one confusing messages "Warning: Please consider changing your password, it will expire in -1 day, 23 Hours and 59 minutes"
whenever I logged into the dashboard. Even after I changed the password again, this message continues to be shown.

Then, I reset the above user's password by admin. The user was requested to change his password again (expectedly).
After that, the above message was no longer shown.

This issue seems to happen only when admin creates a new user and does not change the password of the new user.
I believe this case frequently happens because a password can be specified in our "Create User" form.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-12 10:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> I see a confusing behavior with this patch. See below.
 > 
 > ----
 > 
 > I set [security_compliance] change_password_upon_first_use = True
 > in keystone.conf (and restarted keystone) and then tested your
 > patch.
 > I confirmed the feature worked well in DevStack.
 > A new user succeeded to change his password and logged into the
 > dashboard with the new password.
 > 
 > However, I see one confusing messages "Warning: Please consider
 > changing your password, it will expire in -1 day, 23 Hours and 59
 > minutes"
 > whenever I logged into the dashboard. Even after I changed the
 > password again, this message continues to be shown.
 > 
 > Then, I reset the above user's password by admin. The user was
 > requested to change his password again (expectedly).
 > After that, the above message was no longer shown.
 > 
 > This issue seems to happen only when admin creates a new user and
 > does not change the password of the new user.
 > I believe this case frequently happens because a password can be
 > specified in our "Create User" form.

+1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-12 15:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-12 18:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-13 06:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-13 06:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

My comments in patch set 9 are still valid. (patch set 12 just addressed merge conflicts)'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-16 06:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-16 08:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-16 08:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-16 10:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-17 07:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Does the latest patch set address my following comment in patch set 9?

> I set [security_compliance] change_password_upon_first_use = True in keystone.conf (and restarted keystone) and then tested your patch.
> I confirmed the feature worked well in DevStack.
> A new user succeeded to change his password and logged into the dashboard with the new password.
> 
> However, I see one confusing messages "Warning: Please consider changing your password, it will expire in -1 day, 23 Hours and 59 minutes"
> whenever I logged into the dashboard. Even after I changed the password again, this message continues to be shown.
> 
> Then, I reset the above user's password by admin. The user was requested to change his password again (expectedly).
> After that, the above message was no longer shown.
> 
> This issue seems to happen only when admin creates a new user and does not change the password of the new user.
> I believe this case frequently happens because a password can be specified in our "Create User" form.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-17 08:11:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I don't think I can address that in this patch, as the code involved in displaying that message is outside of scope of this patch — the problem seems to be either in keystone, where it doesn't properly update the expiration date, or in horizon, where it displays that warning wrong. You can verify this by checking that this also happens without this patch (when changing the password from the command line)."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-17 10:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Patch https://review.opendev.org/682604 handles that problem.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-18 07:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> Patch https://review.opendev.org/682604 handles that problem.

Thanks for the workaround :-)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-18 07:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

Looks good now, but -W because of the feature freeze. I think it is mature enough and we can discuss it as FFE if you want.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-18 07:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Workflow-1

Forgot to put -W.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: -Workflow

Ivan and I agree to accept the FFE in the mailing list. I am removing my -W. I would like to leave the final +W for Ivan.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-09-19 13:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Automatically redirect to the password change when it's expired

Unfortunately the only way we can know the user_id at this point is
by parsing the error message.

I also refactored the exceptions in openstack_auth to make them use
different classes (but one common superclass).

Partially implements blueprint: allow-users-change-expired-password

Change-Id: Ieceee09db21040b96577db19bd195dc3799e3892

commit_message:
[dnm] debug permissions issue with manila-share

manila-share runs in a container as a non-privileged
user (manila). It shouldn't need root privileges to
write into its state directory.

Change-Id: I6a8769a6751e76a1adb79ee4e27fc6748a6f1894

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 13:31:59.000000000', 'message': 'PDF documentation build

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

The list of changes:
- copy the missing deps for the doc testenv from
  Ib3bb34191582f581c28f2f8a0281cf3ae44003e8,
- add a new pdf-docs environment to enable PDF build,
- sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is used to handle SVG properly,
- Add requirements for sphinx and poke it for openstackdocstheme,
- disable usage of xindy for tex,
- do not generate empty pages,

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

TeX and  few more packages may be needed to build PDF locally
(listed for bindep):

inkscape [doc platform:dpkg]
fonts-liberation [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive-latex-base [doc platform:dpkg]

commit_message:
PDF documentation build

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

The list of changes:
- copy the docs testenvs' dependencies from
  Ib3bb34191582f581c28f2f8a0281cf3ae44003e8
- do not place unrelated to the docs testenvs entries for the
  test-requieremets.txt, add missing flake8
- add the missing sphinxcontrib-mermaid docs requirements
- render mermaid diagrams only for html builds, for PDF use a hand-made
  quick and dirty approximation instead (if used for PDF builds, it
  fails on the py3 deprecated warn() methos)
- add the project architecture and components into the main ToC, omit
  rendering additional contents pages for PDF builds
- add a new pdf-docs environment to enable PDF build,
- sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter is used to handle SVG properly,
- Add requirements for sphinx and poke it for openstackdocstheme,
- disable usage of xindy for tex,
- do not generate empty pages,

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

TeX and  few more packages may be needed to build PDF locally
(listed for bindep):

inkscape [doc platform:dpkg]
fonts-liberation [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive-latex-base [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive-latex-extra [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive-xetex [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive-fonts-recommended [doc platform:dpkg]
xindy [doc platform:dpkg]
latexmk [doc platform:dpkg]
texlive [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-fncychap [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-titlesec [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-tabulary [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-framed [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-wrapfig [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-upquote [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-capt-of [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-needspace [doc platform:rpm]
texlive-polyglossia [doc platform:rpm]
latexmk [doc platform:rpm]
python3-sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter-common [doc platform:rpm]
librsvg2-tools [doc platform:rpm]
librsvg2-bin [doc platform:dpkg]

Change-Id: Ib3bb34191582f581c28f2f8a0281cf3ae44003e8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
objects: Add 'InstanceNUMATopology.cpu_pinning' property

Provide an easy way to extract all pinned CPUs from an instance's
'InstanceNUMATopology' object

Change-Id: I4b6fb4e239af6d73a07e48339fcbb316aa35cb66
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
bug fixing: let FPGA driver report correct traits when no SRIOV enabled

Bug: when compute node did not enable SRIOV, only have PF on this
node, this driver cannot discover region and function ID traits in
driver_attribute objest.
This patch has fixed this bug.

Change-Id: I3984fc7a91467db7b8cc9b624fdf6a627dff7716

commit_message:
Fix rdo-release install

The URL for rdo-release package is version-less and redirects to latest
stable version. This becomes problematic when stacking older stable
versions as dependencies might not be met or newer and incompatibile
ones might get installed.

Closes-Bug: #1833696

Change-Id: Icb07dcb4c9a3950a3c31a3a8dcb8d0b4c713fdb1
(cherry picked from commit 8b31dce38b630ba3ed1883bcf91a90d296ae44f2)
(cherry picked from commit fb3b6e4baa5a990da70c8b43bca181959a610278)
(cherry picked from commit ed120e335fadc901f9547e347e3c3a51b278bc73)
(cherry picked from commit 6f3696c1680f59c60609d7037983e6cda5d5cdd3)

commit_message:
WIP: Configure tempest flavors with a required trait

There was a regression in the libvirt compute driver such
that trying to create a server with any required trait will
fail. This was not caught in nova functional tests since they
use the fake compute driver. This is a simple devstack change
to recreate the bug.

To tickle the bug we have to configure nova-compute with
a custom cpu_model and a cpu_model_extra_flags value.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/681932/

Change-Id: Ic1a94a946012fd2bf31c60f45886626a5196007b
Related-Bug: #1843836

commit_message:
Add repos to opendev tenant for system-config jobs

A system-config job needs to add jeepyb, ansible and zone-opendev
to require-projects for the job imports to be happy.

Change-Id: I87a8d47388c211a1cfd672f97980f5687b7ad8bd

used for PCPUs going forward. Rename both '_get_pcpu_total' and
'_get_vcpu_total' to '_get_pcpu_available' and '_get_vcpu_available',

value is returned..

since it no longer has any callers.

commit_message:
libvirt: '_get_(v|p)cpu_total' to '_get_(v|p)cpu_available'

We're going to need easier access to the IDs of host cores that can be
used for PCPUs going forward. Rename both '_get_pcpu_total' and
'_get_vcpu_total' to '_get_pcpu_available' and '_get_vcpu_available',
respectively, making some minor modifications to ensure the correct
value is returned..

The 'get_cpu_count' function is removed from 'nova.virt.libvirt.host'
since it no longer has any callers.

Change-Id: I98efdc61fd456fc7f9e1a85238c9ef9bc04a1252
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecation of the ceilometerdb-size validation

Due to the Panko deprecation for the Train release.

Change-Id: Ic6b497b033f52342eb9dcdbdec84c406efecb5ac
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Associate floating IP after lb ACTIVE

There was a chance that the `device_owner` of VIP port changed to
`compute:None` which blocks the VIP subnet clean up, this patch fixed
that.

Change-Id: I39a63584793c1f0aca7a74f01649dd5618d5829e
Story: 2006551
Task: 36634

You are correct, the testing was wrong. I changed the patch to show a reproduce for now, not sure how to approach it best.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-09-19 11:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey Tobias,

Do you know how to reproduce the issue?

If you have some instructions to follow to trigger the problem I can help you to find the right way to test it.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have the issue described in the bug when a project name or description contains special characters it throws an exception. [1].

I can fill in more details in the bug about versioning for Tooz and Ceilometer.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1805119'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:25:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hm I'm running 1.62.0 and https://github.com/openstack/tooz/commit/747f022f2006f831e2e408d54268ded236bbcd7f was introduced in 1.62.1 maybe that solves it

Not sure if it would have an effect though, here is a test with python cli, so not a python file containing a coding header.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/777698/"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Now thinking about it, maybe this is fixed already since Ceilometer throws a unicode here (following the traceback).

https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/polling/manager.py#L479

I should just update to tooz 1.62.1'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-09-19 12:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
include heat_policy.json

If heat-dashboard plugin is enabled, user will encounter an ugly no permssion to
access project error upon logging into Horizon. This error is caused by the
absence of heat_policy.json in Horizon. Per

https://github.com/openstack/heat-dashboard/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L17-#L26

We need to make heat_policy.json available to Horizon before the plugin is
usable.

Change-Id: I93c9ca0077a85f881e7247e502f9e52ed7180f14
(cherry picked from commit 30b96096b01e68b7eab267380f2626515ee97185)

commit_message:
include heat_policy.json

If heat-dashboard plugin is enabled, user will encounter an ugly no permssion to
access project error upon logging into Horizon. This error is caused by the
absence of heat_policy.json in Horizon. Per

https://github.com/openstack/heat-dashboard/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L17-#L26

We need to make heat_policy.json available to Horizon before the plugin is
usable.

Change-Id: I93c9ca0077a85f881e7247e502f9e52ed7180f14
(cherry picked from commit 30b96096b01e68b7eab267380f2626515ee97185)

subject: Safeguard against 'Undef' length() checks.
messages:
[{'account_id': 30126, 'date': '2019-09-16 15:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-09-16 15:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-09-17 06:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-17 20:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We are facing gate issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1844446

To clear the gate we need to abandon this patch and I will restore once the gate is ready again to land patches in TripleO. Please don't touch this patch, and ask on #tripleo Wes or Emilien for any question. Thanks for your patience."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-19 02:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 15:20:26.000000000', 'message': 'Safeguard against 'Undef' length() checks.

Hit the following during a deployment:

"Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call
'length' parameter 'arg' expects a value of type Collection, String,
or Binary, got Undef"

This commit adds a safeguard to skip the length check if
$driver_devices is 'Undef'.

Closes-bug: #1827091

Change-Id: Ide850ab917736f066c38e2e55960a03e1fcd3523
(cherry picked from commit ffdc816e37c7739e4645df08fac574859e2b06ac)
'}]
commit_message:
Safeguard against 'Undef' length() checks.

Hit the following during a deployment:

"Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call
'length' parameter 'arg' expects a value of type Collection, String,
or Binary, got Undef"

This commit adds a safeguard to skip the length check if
$driver_devices is 'Undef'.

Closes-bug: #1827091

Change-Id: Ide850ab917736f066c38e2e55960a03e1fcd3523
(cherry picked from commit ffdc816e37c7739e4645df08fac574859e2b06ac)

commit_message:
Use role assignment list instead of role list

openstack role list is deprecated since Newton and
is removed in openstackclient-4.0.0 with [1]. Use
role assignment list --names instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/612798/

Change-Id: I7bb2d3573c4f7ba092e019a363116bab11cc7063

commit_message:
Fix LogicalSwitchPortUpdateEvent in Octavia provider driver

If port ovn_const.OVN_PORT_NAME_EXT_ID_KEY external_id is not
set we should return empty string for processing instead
None.

Change-Id: I815928e1a67e34c3aa577ee081541b67b2c43ddb
Closes-Bug: 1842901

As ConfigParser tries to convert "%" as a part of the variable[1],
we need to adjust it's default variable inside template for swift
to work with py3 unless this will be fixed in swift by using raw [2]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/configparser.html#configparser.ConfigParser.get
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/account/server.py#L66

Change-Id: I9bbd3195a7b02a55e38207aa4bba182a6e58346c
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1844368
'}]
commit_message:
Update fallocate_reserve to work with py3

As ConfigParser tries to convert "%" as a part of the variable[1],
we need to adjust it's default variable inside template for swift
to work with py3 unless this will be fixed in swift by using raw [2]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/configparser.html#configparser.ConfigParser.get
[2] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/account/server.py#L66

Change-Id: I9bbd3195a7b02a55e38207aa4bba182a6e58346c
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1844368

[{'created': '2019-09-19 10:01:42.000000000', 'message': 'DRAC: Fix a bug for clear_job_queue clean step with non-BIOS pending job

If we create pending non-bios config job( E.g create/delete virtual disk)
with "At next reboot" option and execute "clear_job_queue" clean step,
then that job gets deleted after job execution instead of getting
deleted before job execution.

Change-Id: I138ef53cb6aeb760fe13290b1d200b1128f56e5b
Story: #2006580
Task: #36695
'}]
commit_message:
DRAC: Fix a bug for clear_job_queue clean step with non-BIOS pending job

If we create pending non-bios config job( E.g create/delete virtual disk)
with "At next reboot" option and execute "clear_job_queue" clean step,
then that job gets deleted after job execution instead of getting
deleted before job execution.

Change-Id: I138ef53cb6aeb760fe13290b1d200b1128f56e5b
Story: #2006580
Task: #36695

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 00:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pool API handling of None/null updates

The current pool API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. There was a case where removing the CA and CRL
at the same time could be refused, requiring you to remove the
CRL first, then the CA reference. This patch resolves that issue.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the pool parameters.

Change-Id: Iee8a12b693a09e96e59313e58beffe1b1985084f
Story: 2005374
Task: 31007
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pool API handling of None/null updates

The current pool API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. There was a case where removing the CA and CRL
at the same time could be refused, requiring you to remove the
CRL first, then the CA reference. This patch resolves that issue.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the pool parameters.

Change-Id: Iee8a12b693a09e96e59313e58beffe1b1985084f
Story: 2005374
Task: 31007

[{'created': '2019-05-29 21:37:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix member API handling of None/null updates

The current member API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as weight,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the member parameters.

Change-Id: I41038b1d8d882efa19d991c07dca47f06dcbb5ca
Story: 2005374
Task: 33523
'}]
commit_message:
Fix member API handling of None/null updates

The current member API does not properly handle clearing/reseting
values on update. Some integer only fields, such as weight,
will accept null, but will store the value as "None". These will
will cause failures updating the amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the member parameters.

Change-Id: I41038b1d8d882efa19d991c07dca47f06dcbb5ca
Story: 2005374
Task: 33523

commit_message:
Fix health monitor API handling of None updates

The current health monitor API does not properly handle
clearing/reseting values on update. Some integer only fields,
such as max_retries_down, will accept null, but will store the
value as "None". These will will cause failures updating the
amphora configuration.

This patch corrects this to appropriately handle None/null updates
to the health monitor parameters.

Change-Id: Ida1d544933aec9e5cd556aef57a06e9f19f1b255
Story: 2005374
Task: 33533

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-14 16:16:32.000000000', 'message': 'Validate that server_certs_key_passphrase is 32 characters long

Fernet checks[1] for  32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate the
value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an
invalid passphrase as early as possible.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

Change-Id: I334364d4654491bc0d289472ca9ab5fe462d5139
'}, {'created': '2019-07-14 16:17:52.000000000', 'message': 'Validate that server_certs_key_passphrase is 32 characters long

commit_message:
Validate server_certs_key_passphrase is 32 chars

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

Change-Id: I334364d4654491bc0d289472ca9ab5fe462d5139

gate freeze :) sorry.. sent you an email'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-09-19 00:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-09-19 08:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 10:47:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix image validation when AP services get several images.

When AP (Actif/Passif) service get several images back from the host
the script is broken because it wrongly tests any left over image.

We fix that by sorting them by tag (the higher being at bottom of the
list) and taking only the last one.

We ensure as well that re-running the script doesn't unnecessarily
increase the number of hosts we test for AP services.

Change-Id: I24e05a15975fb5a696d195d87257bc7b7e1c561b
Related-Bug: #1843023
"}]
commit_message:
Fix image validation when AP services get several images.

When AP (Actif/Passif) service get several images back from the host
the script is broken because it wrongly tests any left over image.

We fix that by sorting them by tag (the higher being at bottom of the
list) and taking only the last one.

We ensure as well that re-running the script doesn't unnecessarily
increase the number of hosts we test for AP services.

Change-Id: I24e05a15975fb5a696d195d87257bc7b7e1c561b
Related-Bug: #1843023

commit_message:
Fix container validation after overcloud update.

The current validation script is tuned to docker.  We switch to podman
and adjust the expected output.

Change-Id: I06949a8b63dba58761e901584c1e49b4f63d2356
Closes-Bug: #1843023
(cherry picked from commit 5aa1aee425880f46c9844afab144a6c829145340)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 10:51:44.000000000', 'message': 'Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project should produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is
recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Ia0f8b73bcbda6295319f5c8de1aa02a40844207b

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project should produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is
recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Ia0f8b73bcbda6295319f5c8de1aa02a40844207b

[{'created': '2019-08-29 23:31:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the diskimage-create tox "build" environment

The recently added tox "build" environment had a few problems:
1. It was not honoring the DIB_* environment variables which meant
in always built a master branch image.
2. It also failed to run repeatedly due to a cache directory path issue.
3. The built images were stored in a hidden folder ".amp_tox_test".

This patch fixes those issues, resolves a confusing
"dpkg Broken pipe" message, and adds a "Successfully built" message
at the end of the built that highlights which branch the image was
built against (master, stable/stein, etc.).

commit_message:
Fix the diskimage-create tox "build" environment

The recently added tox "build" environment had a few problems:
1. It was not honoring the DIB_* environment variables which meant
in always built a master branch image.
2. It also failed to run repeatedly due to a cache directory path issue.
3. The built images were stored in a hidden folder ".amp_tox_test".

This patch fixes those issues, resolves a confusing
"dpkg Broken pipe" message, and adds a "Successfully built" message
at the end of the built that highlights which branch the image was
built against (master, stable/stein, etc.).

Change-Id: I826c5f753f159b2d5dee97d4e2922826444ea6da

commit_message:
revert "Ensure that only cloud admins are neutron admins"

We can't add constraints to admin role without consider
regressions. It happens that two tempest scenarios are now failling:

 tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops
 tempest.scenario.test_server_multinode.TestServerMultinode.test_schedule_to_all_nodes

If admin wants to give role (even Admin role) to an user for a tenant,
the right way is to use keystone trust API.

Change-Id: I161ea7d1aec5e5784455b5bce4605b2f9143daa2
Related-Bug: #1830536
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 21:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add --cpuset-cpus support for both Docker and Podman

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22
(cherry picked from commit d6ae074d2567b638fccd32868f6421de4044fbbe)
(cherry picked from commit ec6c50d1986b5e20e128e40a56120f6699a73cb5)

commit_message:
Add --cpuset-cpus support

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22
(cherry picked from commit d6ae074d2567b638fccd32868f6421de4044fbbe)
(cherry picked from commit ec6c50d1986b5e20e128e40a56120f6699a73cb5)

[{'created': '2018-08-28 14:19:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix the undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass error seen with ovs 2.10

puppet-ovn uses puppet-vswitch to configure the OVN params. When OVS binaries are
compiled with dpdk support and when vs_config provider runs the command
'ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch .', the below warning messages are seen and
are part of the command output.

----
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot load glue library: libibverbs.so.1: cannot open shared
object file: No such file or directory
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot initialize PMD due to missing run-time dependency on
rdma-core libraries (libibverbs, libmlx5)
----

We see the error 'undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass' when the result is
extracted. This patch fixes this issue by checking if the 'value' var is nil or
not before 'parse_column_value' is called.

Tripleo deployment with OVN is failing because of this issue.

Change-Id: I415a6229a0fbc1b55451e3738539735afdc6f8f4
Closes-bug: #1789236
(cherry picked from commit b6dab2e9bb08401507d95715734f5841663ae055)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass error seen with ovs 2.10

puppet-ovn uses puppet-vswitch to configure the OVN params. When OVS binaries are
compiled with dpdk support and when vs_config provider runs the command
'ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch .', the below warning messages are seen and
are part of the command output.

----
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot load glue library: libibverbs.so.1: cannot open shared
object file: No such file or directory
PMD: net_mlx5: cannot initialize PMD due to missing run-time dependency on
rdma-core libraries (libibverbs, libmlx5)
----

We see the error 'undefined method 'chomp' for nil:NilClass' when the result is
extracted. This patch fixes this issue by checking if the 'value' var is nil or
not before 'parse_column_value' is called.

Tripleo deployment with OVN is failing because of this issue.

Change-Id: I415a6229a0fbc1b55451e3738539735afdc6f8f4
Closes-bug: #1789236
(cherry picked from commit b6dab2e9bb08401507d95715734f5841663ae055)

commit_message:
Temporarily skip TestNovaMigrationsMySQL

There are several changes approved for Train feature freeze
which are still not merged yet nearly a week later because
of gate failures with bug 1823251. This change skips those
tests temporarily so we can land some code in time for Train
RC1 but this change should be reverted prior to RC1 after
all of those other changes are merged. Note that those
changes (vpmems and pcpu series) don't really have anything
to do with data model schema changes at this point so skipping
this test for now won't drop any coverage for what is going in,
and we aren't merging any other data model schema changes at
this point before RC1. Again, this is a temporary measure and
should be reverted within a few days.

Change-Id: I0564c613f30d321de33a1bd71bfe48c37e72ff80
Related-Bug: #1823251

commit_message:
Add .vscode to .gitignore list

As a vscode user, .vscode folder gots generated while working
on codebase in VS code editor. It needs to be added to gitignore
list otherwise it will be pushed along with code.

Change-Id: Ie64e2a16a1845b07d5e494217a97b91de3b04136
Signed-off-by: Soniya Vyas <svyas@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add the required and optional packages for watcher

There are number of client packages that are required by watcher in
order to function correctly. See

https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher/src/branch/master/watcher/common/clients.py

So add those as requires. Also, ceilometerclient is optional so we add
it as recommends instead.

Change-Id: Icd36642ba4509ac655aaa65c059dd61d763f7b9c

subject: Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command
messages: [{'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2019-09-18 08:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-19 04:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-18 08:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08
(cherry picked from commit 726b06cdb49426719a13be3f02bcce72a697484c)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore defaults for combine and failonfail in openstack command

[1] added "override_locale: false" to the openstack command executions,
to respect the current locale. This had an unintended side effect,
since it changed the values for failonfail and combine to false in
that same execution, as described in [2].

We should ensure that openstack command failures are respected, so
this commit restores that behavior.

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/640997
[2] - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L139-L143

Change-Id: I55e587ea5c83338ae989aa56f1f379079eb02e08
(cherry picked from commit 726b06cdb49426719a13be3f02bcce72a697484c)

commit_message:
Reduce jobs by optimization of irrelevant files

Don't run multinode, standalone and undercloud jobs on changes
which include docs, test files, changes of build images or
containers roles and playbooks.
Change-Id: Ic707606d593ba1b2e80ed6239a39375f9297bf4b

commit_message:
Remove UCS packages from os_ironic

UcsSdk and ImcSdk are not compatible with Py3. This patch
removes them.

Depends-On: I9bbd3195a7b02a55e38207aa4bba182a6e58346c

commit_message:
Fix fault when deleting policy_file

Operator may wants to roll back its policy to default but once
loading policy_file, fault occurs when policy_file is deleted.

Change-Id: I803c41f03a4c17f225fd3d262595ddb9d7bd3b9b
Closes-Bug: 1844292

'}, {'created': '2019-09-13 10:51:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add Redfish inspect interface support for iDRAC

This patch adds support for Redfish inspect interface
implementation for iDRAC.

Depends-On: I11f002eff78d27369b3dbe9a9fbd5fc73496a5eb
Change-Id: I6d8f5cd629e2e17eb86b6f8154a605050e0c7abe
